amazon_reviews.review_title: Amazing Volume and Length: Essence Lash Princess Mascara is a Game-Changer!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I am absolutely in love with the Essence Lash Princess False Lash Effect Mascara! This mascara delivers everything it promises—amazing volume, length, and definition—all without clumping or flaking. The hourglass-shaped brush coats every lash evenly, lifting them to create a full, dramatic look. It gives my lashes a false-lash effect that’s perfect for both everyday wear and special occasions.

What really sets this mascara apart is its lightweight formula. It doesn’t weigh my lashes down or feel heavy, even after multiple coats. I love how buildable it is—whether I want a natural look or something more bold, I can customize it easily. My lashes stay curled all day long, with no smudging or running, even in humid conditions.

As a cruelty-free product, it’s also something I feel good about using. The fact that it’s affordable makes it even better. The mascara comes off easily with makeup remover, but it stays put throughout the day without flaking or smearing.

Overall, Essence Lash Princess Mascara is a must-have in my beauty routine. It offers stunning volume and length at an unbeatable price, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality mascara that delivers dramatic results.

I bought this item because It was recommended in a " best cheap items to buy'.  I have long eyelashes but they are thin and very light.  I do not want to wear false eyelashes.  I bought this as a whim.  I used this product and almost fainted.  I could not believe how full and long my lashes looked.  Every time I use this product I am in awe.  Product was $3.99 per tube.  I've been paying $32/tube.  Buy it.

This is the most affordable mascara on the market that will still give you high end results. I also like that it is easy to remove, I don’t like having to scrub off mascara from the tender eye area.  I do have a bit of a smudge problem with it leaving some smudging under the eyes after a few hours, but I wear an oil based under eye cream so that’s definitely part of the issue. I will continue to buy and use this product and I recommend it highly.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Essence Lash Princess False Lash Effect Mascara Review
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I recently tried the Essence Lash Princess False Lash Effect Mascara, and I must say, it truly lives up to its name! Here's my detailed review:

Natural Lash Effect: This mascara provides a beautiful, natural-looking enhancement to my lashes. It adds volume and length without looking overly dramatic, making it perfect for everyday wear.

Application: The brush is perfectly designed to coat each lash evenly without clumping. The formula glides on smoothly, allowing for easy layering to achieve the desired intensity. However, be mindful of applying too much, as it can weigh down your lashes.

Longevity: It stays put all day long without smudging or flaking, even through long hours and various activities. I didn't experience any issues with it running or causing raccoon eyes, which is a huge plus for me.

Formula: The formula is lightweight and doesn't weigh down my lashes as long as you apply it in moderation. It's also gentle and didn't irritate my eyes.

Packaging: The packaging is cute and practical. The unique design with the green detailing makes it easy to spot in my makeup bag.

Overall: This mascara is an absolute game-changer. It provides the natural volume and length that I love, stays put throughout the day, and doesn't irritate my eyes. I highly recommend the Essence Lash Princess False Lash Effect Mascara to anyone looking for an affordable yet effective solution for naturally beautiful lashes.

I really wanted to love this mascara.  Seriously.  And I did when I first put it on.  The brush separated my lashes beautifully, applied just the right amount of mascara.  Only needed a second coat on the outside edge lashes (they tend to curl down).  Loved how it looked.

Until the late afternoon when I looked in the mirror and GASP!  I saw raccoon eyes.
 What is this?  Maybe too much time staring at the computer?  Too much blinking because I was staring at the computer too much?  User error maybe?
Second day tried again, made sure to use a bit more powder under my eyes.  Did it help?  Sadly no.  By the late afternoon I had mascara under my eyes.
Ok, one last try.... Saturday, no computer work, just errands and lunch.  The disappointment I felt could not be described when I got home and saw the mascara under my eyes again.
Sad to say but will not buy again.  Back to the more expensive mascara.

Let me start off by saying I just finished chemotherapy for breast cancer and lost most ALL of my hair including my eyebrows and eyelashes thinning out soooo bad.
This mascara has brought life back to my eyes and with the most amazing price considering I can't work right now. Please never take this mascara away or raise the price! If you are reading this- buy it! You won't regret it. Doesn't flake off. Dries fast. Last all night. 10/10 for sure. I'm honestly flabbergasted that they priced it so cheap!

In my younger years I would figure, "the pricier the product, the better the quality", right? Well, if you;ve been on an endless mascara saga like me, we both know now that, that isn't always the case. Lash Princess mascara brand has easily become my go to mascara choice, hands down.

I use this brown mascara paired with the Lash Princess primer and it makes my eyes really pop and my lashes stand out more than they would with any Revlon, Maybelline, IT cosmetics, etc. tubes of mascara. I recommend this brand to anyone that mentions their mascara brand hiccups.

It doesn't clump. It doesn't flake off. It doesn't run at the slightest hint of humidity, sweat, or heat. It lasts all day with the same look it gives at first application and it doesn't take harsh rubbing and multiple products to remove at the end of the day. And the brown hue of this product makes your eyes stand out without that bold blackness if you're an individual who prefers the more natural take on make-up.

Very good mascara. Makes lashes appear longer and thicker. Easy to apply with no clumping. Good, all day wear with no flaking. Easy enough to remove. ( I use coconut oil) I have used some amazing high end mascaras and some less expensive mascaras that turned out to be kind of crappy. This little beauty performs way above its price point in my opinion. Will buy again when it's time to replace.

I tried it as soon as it arrived. I placed it on top of my Maybeline Great Lash mascara I put on this morning. I wanted to see reviews comparing the before and after before I bought and didn’t find many so I figured I’d provide a comparison. I think it looks pretty good. Better than thrive causemetics lash formula which is $20 more. It feels creamy and easy to wipe from the skin if it gets smeared on application. I have to try it all day to see how it does but so far seems great for the price.

I read about this mascara on Buzzfeed and figured I would give it a try. Yes, it does create a false lash effect! I was impressed on how well it worked! However, because it's not waterproof, over time the mascara leaves smudges on my skin. After a few hours, I need to apply makeup remover to remove the faint black spots from the mascara. But the effect is great! It definitely creates an optical illusion of longer and fuller lashes. I just wish it would rub off on my skin over time.

items.title: eos Shea Better Body Lotion- Vanilla Cashmere, 24-Hour Moisture Skin Care, Lightweight & Non-Greasy, Made with Natural Shea, Vegan, 16 fl oz

amazon_reviews.review_title: Did I finally just find the perfect lotion?
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Yes I did!  I have been searching high and low, for years, and spent tons of money in my quest to find the perfect lotion. I bet a lot of us can relate and I have to share, I love this stuff!!  It is soft and silky, absorbs and dries immediately with no sticky feeling or residue, while leaving skin moisturized all day. The scent is very minimal with a lovely hint of vanilla and the description is apt because it really feels like cashmere. Makes the daily chore of moisturizing so much more enjoyable and that you're doing a good thing for your skin. Luxury moisturizer at an amazing price, yes please!

I absolutely love the EOS Coconut Waters Lotion! It’s hands down one of the best lotions I’ve tried. The formula is incredibly hydrating without being greasy, absorbing quickly into my skin and leaving it feeling soft and smooth all day. The scent is light, fresh, and subtly coconut-y, making it perfect for everyday use without overpowering any fragrances.

What I really appreciate is how it nourishes my skin without leaving a sticky residue. It’s great for both my hands and body, and I’ve noticed a real improvement in my skin's texture and moisture levels since I started using it. Plus, the bottle is sleek and easy to use, so I can take it with me on the go.

Overall, the EOS Coconut Waters Lotion is a winner in my book – it’s affordable, effective, and smells amazing. I’ll definitely be repurchasing! Highly recommend!

I bought this cream because of a recommendation for the scent, but I’ll buy it again because of the texture and the quality of the product! This is phenomenal stuff. The texture is smooth and creamy, but with no oiliness. Intensely moisturizing and the scent is absolute heaven for vanilla lovers. Honestly, I can’t get enough of this cream, but it makes me hungry for delicious creamy treats! The sun really lasts, too.

Absolutely love this product. Me and my mother both have our own and its anazing.
Cons:
can be hard to get all the product out due to the pump ( you can take off the lid or change out the lid with a different one to get the full product out)
Pros:
smells delicious
perfect anount of thickness its thick but not too thick
get a good product and a good amount of product for a good price

I am picky with lotion because I dont like most scents, but I really like this one!

The Raspberry smell actually smells good and not like a weird, nauseating fake fruit smell. The scent does not last all day on my skin, but that is not a deal breaker for me.

This lotion absorbs quickly, is not greasy or tacky, and helps my skin not feel dry and itchy.

I've bought it twice already and I will likely buy it again and again.

amazon_reviews.review_title: the HONEST REVIEW you’re looking for
amazon_reviews.review_comment: My package was delivered on time and honestly it is a really good lotion, however, the lotion itself felt rather warm but that’s probably because it’s like 90° outside; when I’d first used it, it reminded me of like yogurt kind of? It only reminded me of yogurt because I heard on tiktok that some people said that’s what the smell had reminded them of. Honestly, it did smell underwhelming at first, maybe it was just a bad batch, but after i had let the lotion cool in my freezer it smelled heavenly. I got used to the smell after a few hours and now I constantly keep smelling myself it’s addicting. Now, I won’t say it’s the best scent ever and it is kind of overhyped but if you’re looking for a lotion that is subtle yet smells flavorful you should totally get it. The lotion smells very rich, creamy, sweet, yummy, and overall very scrumdiliumtious; especially when you apply it. On the other hand, it does smell kind of bitter or sour like a yogurt or milk from time to time so based on first impressions I’d say I wouldn’t have liked it. Like if someone were to wear this and hug me i’d think they smelt a bit weird you know but overtime it starts to smell good in a way I don’t know how to explain it. If you see this review and you still want to try it I warn you that it may smell either bad or good; it depends on the person honestly. Personally, I love it like a lottt but i do think it could use a stronger enhanced vanilla scent; so I am going to add some essential oils and add it into my bodycare routine to smell so edible and yummy. I’d say the lotion pairs well with most body oils, mists, perfumes, etc that al compliment that vanilla rich creaminess with a sweet and delicious flavor. If you are planning on using it alone only I’d say to not get it unless you’d wanna be dissatisfied. For like $8-9 though I’d say it’s worth trying out and if you like it you like it, but if you don’t you don’t. Now for the size comparison I’d say it is quite big, personally i think it’s worth it so once I run out I will be buying another. Like the size of the lotion is bigger than my hand which says a lot because my hands are quite big. Now if you’re planning on using this to moisturize your body, I’d say it is okay but there is much better lotions out there but it is good to add into your routine if you wanna smell like vanilla. It does leave a nice smooth texture on my skin though and it lasts for a good amount of time; the scent does last indeed. Now for the thickness i’d say it isn’t that light but it isn’t heavy weighted either, honestly feels like the texture of yogurt which is honestly a coincidence considering some people say it does in fact smell like yogurt. Now for the value for money i’d say it is really worth it considering the fact that it is quite big and costs less; definitely get it if you’re looking for an affordable lotion. Anyways, that’s about all, I hope my review did help you I know I would have for sure liked to hear this from someone else before I’d gotten it! Overall, I’m rating it a 3.5/5 which is basically a 7/10!

This lotion was AMAZINGGG. i’ve been trying to find a good vanilla lotion for a very long time and this one was perfect, came overnight, a good amount of thickness, feels good on your skin, smells HEAVENLY. i could smell it before i even pumped it. will be buying again. It also stayed on me for about an hour. but that’s about it.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Obsessed! Smooth, Delicious, and Gluten-Free Body Lotion!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The eos Shea Better Body Lotion in Coconut Waters is honestly a new favorite in my skincare lineup, and here’s why:

Gluten-Free & Skin-Loving Ingredients:
As someone who watches for gluten-free products, finding a lotion that’s not only safe but also made with natural shea and vegan ingredients is a huge win! This feels so gentle and nourishing on my skin, with ingredients I trust.

Amazing Scent & Texture:
The coconut scent is absolutely delicious without being overpowering. It’s that perfect, light tropical vibe. And the texture? Butter smooth! It glides on effortlessly and feels luxurious every time I use it.

24-Hour Moisture Without the Grease:
I love that this lotion keeps my skin soft and hydrated all day long without feeling greasy. It’s lightweight, absorbs quickly, and leaves my skin feeling amazing—no residue, just smooth, happy skin.

The Bottom Line:
If you’re looking for a body lotion that’s gluten-free, beautifully scented, and leaves your skin feeling incredible, I couldn’t recommend this one more. It’s a total game-changer!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Not a Strawberry Dream —> Ranking All Scents
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
ANOTHER UPDATE ~ These lotions really got me going through it. After trying all scents I have a solid ranking that can help others.
1. Fresh & Cozy
2. Strawberry Dream (Fresh & Cozy and Strawberry Dream are interchangeable but Fresh & Cozy seems more universal and versatile)
3. Coconut Waters (Coconut Waters was 4th before because Pink Champagne is more exotic smelling and I’m trying to give a more universal rating but it’s definitely more my personality so I had to switch it.)
4. Pink Champagne
5. Vanilla Cashmere
6. Jasmine Peach
7. Pomegranate Raspberry

eos Shea Better Fresh & Cozy Moisture Body Lotion
Morning light, dewy cassis and sheer musk
The fragrance of “Fresh & Cozy” is so simple yet anything but underwhelming. When you focus on the scent, it, to me, is the epitome of comfort. I highly appreciate it. This is the best out of the ones I’ve tried for the versatility. It’s not the loudest scent out of the line. It’s also not prettiest or overtly feminine scent in the world. But it’s the prettiest universal “clean”/low key scent I’ve ever smelled. It’s like pretty linens not just linens and that is obviously attributed to the cassis. I don’t have anything as refreshing yet feminine as this. Makes no sense how comforting it smells.

eos Shea Better Strawberry Dream Moisture Body Lotion
sparkling strawberry, pink sugar, and vanilla cream
I initially was disappointed by this scent because the strawberry note is not as strong as I was expecting and it doesn’t last on the skin but this is the best scent for my body chemistry and i really like the slightly creamy pink sugar smell that remains for hours, even until the next day, on my skin! It makes me feel really cute yet it’s not immature to me! It is BY FAR the longest lasting fragrance out of the ENTIRE line on me and It’s actually my favorite now after prolonged use. I get it now I was just impatient. I wanted to make it #1 but everyone’s taste is different.

eos Shea Better Pink Champagne Moisture Body Lotion
pear champagne, ruby pomegranate & plum suede
juicy, different. pretty. feminine. I had my mom put it on and it reaffirmed my opinion of it. the sillage and projection is much stronger on her. Smells very good and exotic. I haven’t always been into scented lotions so the notes in this are very intriguing to me. It’s just so good! It’s notes are loud and distinct on my skin yet the overall exotic scent doesn’t last as long on me. this definitely can be in 3rd place. but it’s not as versatile for my personality. It’s VERY pretty and unique. It doesn’t stand out on my skin as distinctly or as long as Strawberry Dream. It actually leaves my skin in an hour and what remains is a sheer pear/plum musky smell for an additional hour. Interesting. I don’t like categorizing scents by seasons but it definitely gives off summer vibes. I’m a Autumn/Winter girl.

eos Shea Better Coconut Waters Moisture Body Lotion
creamy coconut, lush hibiscus and solar musk
I am most surprised by this lotion as I tried to stay away from coconut scented products because they always smell like piña colada. I don’t want anything tropical. Like I mentioned before I love milky and creamy scents and I was hoping it would smell like coconut milk and for now this is as close as I’ll get. it is more creamy and musky than tropical and it’s overall really pretty. I like it more than Pink Champagne and wear it more. So creamy! The hibiscus in this definitely helps it. I find this to be more interesting than the vanilla cashmere as that one to me just smells like caramel. I also put a baby oil on top of this and i’m telling you it smells so creamy and yummy.

eos Shea Better Vanilla Cashmere Moisture Body Lotion
whipped vanilla, soft musk and cozy caramel
I love vanilla, I love cream, I love milk scents. This isn’t bad but I can see how someone sensitive to scented products would smell burnt plastic instead of caramel. It’s more caramel than vanilla. Surprisingly my least favorite. A true vanilla lotion would be the one from The Lotion Company. That one is straight vanilla bean. The caramel isn’t cozy to me and is too sweet. A very gummy burnt (not in a bad way) caramel scent. I like smelling like a snack but it’s a bit too much for me. It actually gives me a headache. There’s nothing soft or cozy about this. I think I find this to smell a bit too juvenile for me. It’s clearly about personal taste. I know many adults who like this. I think teenager every time I smell it. Strawberry Dream has a creaminess mixed into so I can take it a bit more seriously i guess.

eos Shea Better Jasmine Peach Moisture Body Lotion
apricot nectar, sparkling jasmine, and vanilla sugar
I was looking for some thing similar to the Johnson baby lotion in the pink bottle but without the green leafy note. It’s a bit feminine, but not powdery and babyish. You get more jasmine than peach. It’s basically jasmine with a sour undertone. It’s, so far, the least impressive out of the bunch. it’s also a bit screechy/pissy on me sometimes. Fresh & Cozy is stronger and lasts longer than this. The smell goes so fast and it’s not even that noticeable so I’m returning. I keep going nose blind to it. When I do smell it I’m just sure you can find something stronger and less simple at bath and body works and i don’t even shop there. It’s just not that good and I personally like jasmine as a fragrance note in perfumes. My mother likes it. It smells like grandma to me and I usually like scents that lean more sensual and/or mature.

eos Shea Better Pomegranate Raspberry Moisture Body Lotion
luscious pomegranate blended with tart raspberries and lotus blossom
It’s not bad. It’s not for my personality. Unlike Jasmine Peach, you can smell this one easily. Not interested in tart scents but thought I’d try anyway. It reminds me of a scent of hand sanitizer I would’ve gotten from bath and body works. It’s an average lotion scent and it’s not bad. Not my choice. if Jasmine Peach Was better I would prefer it over this if I was forced to choose.

~ OLD Update: I raised it a star. I like strawberry dream but when it dries it’s just pink sugar. Not much cream. no strawberry. It’s cute. not that interesting but my nose welcomed the smell a bit more and i won’t return it. i’m not *AS* disappointed. ~

OLD REVIEW ~
It’s more sugar and cream and hardly any strawberry. I can’t believe I like Pink Champagne more than Strawberry Dream. It’s not bad but it smells like sugar cookies or biscuits. I was hoping for a strawberry cupcake vibe. There’s no strawberry once rubbed in. You only smell it right out of the bottle. For Pink Champagne I give it 4.5 stars because although I don’t usually like fruity smells, plum is not that common of a fragrance note for me to associate it with anything childish or juvenile. Plum and pear smell quite good. Lol i’m only 23 but i don’t like smelling like Skittles. I really don’t regret buying that one! Especially because I have others in my collection so it’s a good addition. Vanillas, milks, and cream scents are really nice and Strawberry Dream is a basic sugary scent that I’m unimpressed by. Disappointing. It doesn’t smell bad it’s just not as interesting or strong as the other lotions. Even Fresh and Cozy is more unique than this. Good thing is these lotions are the only lotions I feel that don’t leave my skin dry or absorb instantly. It leaves a bit of lubrication behind on the skin and not just a thin “dry” layer of oil. A nice silky finish on the skin. Comfortable and good value.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Not for sensitive noses, but makes skin so soft
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Was excited to try the vanilla cashmere since a lot of reviews said that the scent was light and subtle. Hoo boy, I must be sensitive to scent cause this stuff is strong. My husband could smell it across the room. It's REALLY sweet and has a bit of a chemical smell. I know vanilla scent is always a risk if smelling too sweet, but I was hoping the "cashmere" part might add a more mature depth to the smell. It did not.  It very much smells like a child's scent. I smell like I just popped out of an easy bake oven. I'm still giving 4 stars cause it does make my skin very soft, im just not a fan if this scent. Returning liquids is a pain so I'll just finish the bottle, but if I buy again in the future, I'll definitely go with unscented or cozy fresh.

category: Best Sellers in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry

items.title: Hanes Men's Hoodie, EcoSmart Fleece Hoodie, Hooded Sweatshirt for Men

amazon_reviews.review_title: Great Quality and Value – Super Warm and Comfortable!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The Hanes Men’s EcoSmart Fleece Hoodie has exceeded my expectations for an affordable, everyday sweatshirt. The material is thick and warm, making it ideal for chilly days, and I appreciate that it’s made with recycled polyester—nice to have an eco-friendly option that doesn’t skimp on quality. It’s soft on the inside and has held up well to washing, maintaining both its shape and softness over time.

The fit is true to size with a comfortable, relaxed cut, and the hood provides good coverage without being too bulky. The cuffs and waistband are sturdy, adding to the overall durability. I also love the spacious kangaroo pocket; it’s great for keeping hands warm or storing small items.

For anyone looking for an affordable, cozy hoodie that works for both lounging and casual outings, this Hanes hoodie is a solid choice. Amazing value for the price!
You can't go wrong with Hanes. These are stylish but also super comfy and warm and has a lot of stretch to it. Great quality and true to size.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Comfy, affordable, and could be better
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I liked the material, And how it wasn't heavy, or overly thick, like some other hoodies that I own. I'll admit I don't like how *thin* it is, at least, it's thin enough that I can see my shirts through it in certain lighting. The sizing is also fairly snug, and as someone who prefers things a bit oversized, a Medium was a bit too snug for my liking. I would recommend a size or two up, depending on your comfort levels.

I order a brown size small hoodie. The color is not exactly the the brown in the picture but it will work. It's a chalky coco color. Lightweight for me. Fleece inside and comfortable.  The men's small to me fits like a ladies large. I will update after I wash it. But for the price it a keeper f I r my streets tye outfit because it's not bulky at all and will fit under bomber jacket. 5star for me. Not the big bulky hoodie. It's super lightweight and nice. Oh it does have a seam at the left bottom side of the ribbing but it's ok.
Fits true to size. Excellent quality and oh so comfortable. Vibrant color. Did not fade in the washer. No shrinkage in the dryer.
This is the softest hoodie ever. Absolutely love it. Great color. Perfect sizing. Want so many of these!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Black LARGE was sized too big.  Light green LARGE fit well.
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
GREEN (LARGE):  Fits great.  Looks good.  Mine was $20.
BLACK (LARGE).  Mine was $10.  This one is too big in the belly.  I'm a normal 6ft, 170lbs and it's too big in the waist/belly.  For the black colored hoodie, a breeze can blow up the back and sides which defeats the point of a sweatshirt/hoodie.  The fit is also unflattering for a fit person.

This pull-over hoody is made very well with a Fleece interior making it very soft and comfortable to wear.
Ordered a slightly larger size due to the 50% cotton 50% polyester as I expect some shrinkage.
Love the shade of color that is so pleasing to the eye and yet is not commonly found…except here, nice!
The hood drawstrings do seem a bit thinner than the usual IMHO but, they do the job on the rare occasion I use them.
Overall this is an excellent value for the money.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Little on the small side but still nice.
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I am a big guy so when I saw these where available in a 5xl and in the black Friday sale I grabbed one for me and my dad. I have not given my dad his yet, but I opened mine and I like it but not as great as I was hoping for. It's not as soft as I thought a Fleece sweatshirt would be and it defiantly runs smaller. It fits more like a 4xl so it's a little tight, but it will still work to keep me warm this winter.  I will update after the holiday and my dad try's his on being a xl.

I bought this to wear under a work issued vest. I've purchased specific work/company branded (pirated) hoodies before and the idea is sound, but this time, I wanted hoodie I could wear outside of work as well. This hoodie is definitely soft and very comfortable. Combined with the aforementioned mentioned vest, it will be a welcome addition to my work wear. My concern is in its' thickness. It isn't, really. It should suffice for the season (Winter and Spring) but I don't hold out much hope beyond that. Keep in mind, lasting the season means 5 or 6 days a week for up to 16 hours a day, rain, wind, and snow. So it's not getting an easy ride, but time will tell if it makes it to next winter or needs to be replaced. Then again, for the price, I can afford to replace it every year without feeling some kind of way about it. I paid about $16 for it, so it's a bargain.

items.title: Hanes EcoSmart Fleece, Cotton-Blend Pullover, Crewneck Sweatshirt for Men (1 Or 2 Pack)

amazon_reviews.review_title: Good Quality for the Price, but Some Room for Improvement
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I've been wearing the Hanes Men's EcoSmart sweatshirt for a couple of months now, and I have a mixed bag of experiences to share.

Pros:

Comfort and Fit: The sweatshirt is quite comfortable to wear. It has a nice, relaxed fit that doesn't feel too tight or too loose. It's perfect for lounging around the house or running errands.

Eco-Friendly: I appreciate that it's made with up to 5% recycled plastic bottles. It's a small step toward sustainability, which is a win in my book.

Warmth: It's reasonably warm for a lightweight sweatshirt. Great for those slightly chilly days when you don't need a heavy coat but still want an extra layer.

Cons:

Durability: After a few washes, I noticed some pilling on the fabric. It's not a deal-breaker, but it does make the sweatshirt look a bit worn out sooner than I expected.

Sizing: The sizing can be a bit inconsistent. I ordered a medium, which fits perfectly, but a friend ordered the same size, and it was slightly larger on him. So, you might want to double-check the size chart before purchasing.

Color Fading: The color fades slightly after a few washes. It still looks okay, but it's not as vibrant as it was when it first arrived.

Overall, the Hanes Men's EcoSmart sweatshirt is a solid choice if you're looking for an affordable, comfortable, and eco-friendly option. Just be aware of the potential for minor durability issues and color fading. For the price, though, it's hard to beat!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Good Size and Warm for Holidays
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I bought this sweater as an easy gift for my boyfriend. I was surprised to see how nice it was despite the cheap price tag! It fits true to size and was super soft. Would definitely be a good layering too while it’s cold out. I’m sure it will last him at least a couple of years as it seems durable. Very pleased with my purchase.

My husband, my children, and I have all had many Hanes sweatshirts. Picking a color can be hard — sometimes they arrive looking too unlike the photo. Otherwise, they’re perfect in terms of thickness, comfort, price, and longevity. I’m 5’0” and feel they’re comfortably roomy without being frumpy. I have many sizes but like medium.

I recently picked up a Hanes sweatshirt, and while it’s an okay option, it didn’t quite live up to my expectations compared to the Fruit of the Loom sweatshirts I’ve owned in the past.

The fit is decent, and it’s comfortable enough for lounging around the house or running errands. However, I found that the fabric feels a bit thinner and less substantial than what I'm used to with Fruit of the Loom. While it keeps me warm, it lacks that cozy, heavyweight feel that I really enjoy in a sweatshirt.

One thing I appreciated about the Hanes sweatshirt is the variety of colors and styles available, so there’s something for everyone. Still, in terms of overall quality and comfort, I would choose Fruit of the Loom any day. If you're looking for a basic sweatshirt that will get the job done, this Hanes option is fine, but for those who prioritize warmth and durability, I recommend going with Fruit of the Loom instead.

This is hands down the best sweatshirt you can get for the price.  I’ve bought 4 of them.  They are comfortable, fit perfectly (I’m 143lb, I get a large), and you cannot beat the price.  The quality is also very good.  I want more of them.  Honestly cannot say enough good things.
When it first arrived I thought the fabric felt pretty rough.  Once I washed it, it felt really soft and warm.  Very reasonable price and the fit is perfect.  Great value!
Great color nice and thick, great fit not slim but not oversized. Great material. Perfect to lounge around or dress it up. Would repurchase

amazon_reviews.review_title: Several things to be aware of
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
FOR REFERENCE:  I bought 2 of the sweatshirts in Stonewash Green, sizes Medium and Large.

My intent was to find something reasonably priced, warm, and comfy to wear - mainly so I could quickly put together a basic, casual, and decent looking outfit that was suitable to wear in public.  I wanted a sweatshirt I could launder at least 15 times before it became too worn out looking to try to wear at a social event.  Even after the appearance degraded, I still wanted the sweatshirt to remain warm, comfy, and in tact so I could wear it while lounging inside my home or during other situations that didn't require me to look quite as put together.

I'm a female, 5'6 tall, about 115 lbs, 32C bra size, 26 inch waist, and 36.5 inch hips. I have slightly broader shoulders and a slightly longer torso than the average female of my size.  I have a slender build.
I wanted one sweatshirt to fit pretty loose (for layering and comfort) and another to have a trendy oversized looked.

I definitely should have bought larger sizes, and I don't think these sweatshirts will hold up the way I had hoped.

MAIN THOUGHTS:  Overall quality is "barely okay." (I guess it really depends on how you intend to use this sweatshirt and the pricing. You may find the quality to be acceptable... or very disappointing.)  Shrinks a lot after just one wash - almost by a size and a half.  Shrinkage is more drastic in the length of the body and sleeves, but also affects the width.  Overall, does not launder well under "normal conditions."  You may have to be very careful to avoid any heat or abrasiveness to keep this sweatshirt looking its best for as long as possible. (Not worth the effort, IMO.)  Stains show easily on this particular color and are surprisingly difficult to remove.  Possible dye issues.  The large sweatshirt came out with what appears to be bleached/faded spots on the bottom banding. (We don't use bleach or a lot of harsh chemicals in my home due to allergies and skin sensitivity issues. So, I'm not sure how this occured. No other clothing item came out of the laundry with the same problem.)  Already noticed some slight pilling in spots.  Barely noticeable now, but this is only after one laundry session.  Sweatshirts aren't very warm, but they are comfortable (as long as you get the correct size).

If you choose to buy this sweatshirt, I'd recommend you buy 1-2 sizes larger to account for shrinkage and to allow for layering.  If you only plan to wear a thin tank top underneath, you probably don't need to size up too much.  But if you plan to wear a long sleeve thermal underneath and still want a loose fit, I'd go up 2 sizes.

MORE SPECIFIC DETAILS:  This sweatshirt is between light-weight and mid-weight thickness.  It's more suitable to wear during chilly/cooler days in the Fall or Spring.  It's not enough to keep someone warm during very cold Winter weather without adding several layers underneath and on top.

I wore both sweatshirts twice before washing them.  Once with only a tank top underneath, and once with a thin long sleeve thermal underneath.  Then I machine washed them in semi-warm water and dried them on medium heat (being careful not to leave them in the dryer more than necessary).

BEFORE LAUNDERING:  Both sweatshirts felt slightly rough (nothing really bothersome or too noticeable) and disappointingly thin.  The color was as expected - a lovely muted, pale green.  One sweatshirt arrived with excess threads hanging from the bottom.  But I was able to safely cut them off without risk of anything unraveling.  I liked the way both tops fit and draped.  The sizes were as I hoped they would be.  I accidentally spilled a cold, milky coffee drink on the smaller sweatshirt.  I treated it with a pre-wash stain remover.  Then threw both sweatshirts in the washer with a pair of jeans and no-lint sports towel (all similar colors as the sweatshirts).

AFTER LAUNDERING:  Both tops became softer and slightly fluffier after washing.  This made them feel a bit thicker and warmer.  Both were noticably smaller, though.  The large top now fits similar to the way the medium used to fit.  Except it's a tad bit shorter. Both tops no longer drape the way they did before I washed them.  It's not a huge issue for me, though.  The banding on both tops also shrank a bit.  I no longer like the way the medium fits me.  Prior to washing, the end of the sleeves reached halfway down my fingers.  The sleeve cuffs were loose enough that I could have them drape that way, but just snug enough that I could pull them back around my wrists.  Now the wrist cuffs sit snuggly around my wrists.  When I reach for items above my head, the sleeves pull back a bit, exposing more of my wrists... and the waist hem rides up so that I have to yank it down when I drop my arms back down to my sides.  (That's how badly the top shrank in length after just one wash!)  The brown color from where I spilled my coffee on the medium top was gone, but there's still a visible stain.  It just looks a couple shades darker than the sweatshirt color... like I spilled water on myself and it's starting to dry a bit.  (I'm going to try a different stain remover and wash it again.  Hopefully it works, otherwise this top will permanently look dirty.)  As I already mentioned, the larger top had some pale pumkin-yellow spots on the lower banding - similar to what bleach spots would look like.  I'm okay with the fit of the larger size sweatshirt even after it shrank.  So, it's a shame that the color bled the way it did.

Overall, I'm disappointed with my purchases.  These are already going to be dedicated lounging and housework shirts.  They are a bit warmer and very soft inside, which is nice.  And nothing has unraveled, so it seems the stitching is good.  I don't think these would be great for screen-printing, simply because of the amount of shrinkage and the fact that they're already showing signs of pilling in areas that don't get much friction.

Hope this info helps. If anything, these aren't bad sweatshirts to have on hand to adapt to temperature fluctuations.  They're stretchy, so they're easy to quickly throw on as an extra layer and take off as needed.  Just be mindful they leave some lint behind on 100% cotton shirts.  The lint problem will probably diminish after a few washes, though.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Comfortable and Versatile – Perfect for Everyday Wear
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I recently bought a pullover crewneck sweatshirt, and it’s quickly become one of my go-to pieces of clothing. Here’s what I think:

Pros:
 • Soft and Cozy: The fabric is soft and comfortable, providing just the right amount of warmth for cooler days. It’s cozy without being too thick or heavy, making it perfect for layering.
 • Casual Style: The classic crewneck design is simple but stylish, easy to pair with jeans, leggings, or shorts. It’s a versatile piece that works for a range of casual outfits.
 • Durable: After several washes, the sweatshirt has maintained its shape and softness. There’s no pilling or shrinkage, which is a plus for long-term wear.
 • Breathable: Despite being warm, the fabric is breathable enough to keep you comfortable during mild weather without overheating.
 • Affordable: It’s a great value for the price, providing both quality and comfort without breaking the bank.

Cons:
 • Basic Design: While the simplicity is part of the appeal, some may find the design too plain or lacking in extra details like a pocket or unique stitching.
 • Fit Can Vary: Depending on the brand, the fit might be a little loose or tight, so it’s important to check sizing carefully.

Overall: The pullover crewneck sweatshirt is a must-have for anyone looking for an easy, comfortable wardrobe staple. It’s cozy, durable, and versatile enough to wear on a daily basis, making it a great addition to any casual wardrobe.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Hanes EcoSmart Fleece Cotton-Blend Pullover Crewneck Sweatshirt
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The Hanes EcoSmart Fleece Crewneck Sweatshirt offers excellent value and comfort, but it has a few shortcomings.

Pros:
 • The fabric is soft and cozy on the inside, especially when worn without an undershirt.
 • It seems durable, holding up well even after washing.
 • The sleeve length is true to size, making it a good fit for most.
 • The price is fantastic for the quality provided.

Cons:
 • The overall length of the sweatshirt is shorter than expected, which might be a drawback for taller individuals or those preferring a longer fit.

Overall, this sweatshirt is a great buy for its comfort, durability, and affordability. However, the shorter length prevents it from being a perfect five-star product.

Rating: 4/5

items.title: Comfort Colors Adult Heavyweight Short Sleeve Tee, Style G1717/G1745

amazon_reviews.review_comment: The Comfort Colors Adult Heavyweight Short Sleeve Tee is pleasing and priced well. The sizing does not constrict my arms or torso as most T-shirts do. The color is rich. The material is soft and not thin - it's strong.

This shirt was featured in the New York Times Wirecutter column, which rightly shouted its praise. Inexpensive, soft, strong.

Just make sure you buy the right size. I'm 6'3 and weigh 173 lb and the large hung on me. The medium was better, and it was also long enough (though a bit of extra length would have been nice - wish they came in tall sizes).

Color selection is adequate but could be better.

I love every minute I spend in these Tees! The colors are holding up perfectly and there is absolutely no shrink in the washer and dryer.

I did notice the hemlines curl a bit after the dryer so I might choose to hang dry to make sure they last as long as possible.

The quality, look and feel make these a perfect purchase, and a long-term favorite.

5 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

amazon_reviews.review_title: Nice T's But Variations To Watch
amazon_reviews.review_comment: OK, after reading the reviews of these T's on Wire Cutter I imagine that many of us thought "wow! a great and reasonably priced t-shirt that seems to cover all the bases! Well yeah but..here are a couple of points to be careful about. First, the fabric quality while good for both of the styles and colors I bought vary from style to style. My first purchase was a two pack of the blue patterned shirts and they were definitely comfy so I bought two other shirts in non-patterned colors. The fabric was very different from the two pack. Comfortable yes but not nearly as soft. Second, the sizes were also very different. I'm normally an XXL in T's but the patterned shirts were huge on me. I then ordered XL's for the second order and they were way too small. There's just a wide difference in both fabric and size that seems to depend on patterned versus solid. I know that the company that owns Comfort Colors has a separate brand but in the Wire Cutter review they made a statement that the CC's were far more comfortable than their cousins. I don't know if they're mixing shirts between companies but felt that while I liked both shirts the differences and variations were concerning.

I bought a bunch of these shirts for my husband after reading the NYT Wirecutters review, and they are as good as the reviewer said. Tired of seeing my husband wearing old shirts (some with holes, some just faded and gross) around the house. And these are inexpensive enough that I don't feel guilty about replacing those old shirts or turning them into rags either.

Now that I've washed them all, I can say that washing them just makes them better. No shrinkage but softer feel.

I love heavyweight t-shirts. The Comfort Colors t-shirt have a very nice, heavy feel to them. The fit and finish is wonderful. And, frankly, they feel great. I bought a 2-pack and I'll be a repeat buyer very soon.

I got an extraordinary price that is no longer available.  These shirts are great.  I found them through NY Times Wirecutter, which has never steered me wrong.  At least in my experience, these T shirts are the best that money can buy.  Soft, substantial and great fit.  Highest recommendation.

amazon_reviews.review_title: I'm sure I'm not the only one who bought this shirt after the Wirecutter review....
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I had high hopes after the absolutely gushing review in Wirecutter in the NYT. I'm always looking for a tshirt upgrade for a reasonable price.

I was underwhelmed by the product I received. It seemed to bear no relation to what was reviewed. It was scratchy and slippery, not a "feeling of a lush, almost buttery cotton draped over my shoulders."
The overall weight is nice but it doesn't really "drape" although maybe that will change after a few more washes.

The overall fit is...odd. Tight around the shoulders, loose around the chest and a collar that stands uncomfortably high.

There are other retailers that sell much softer heavyweight cotton Ts for just a couple bucks more if you buy on sale. After buying t-shirts from a couple dozen different sellers, sometimes at ridiculous prices, I keep coming back to the same mainstream very well known retailer that combines a huge selection with some great prices on sale. They all seem to be made of quality long lasting fabric and come in a wide variety weights and cuts.

I was about to give a rating of 2 stars but I think the Wirecutter review raised my expectations too much which made the reality seem worse. 3 stars for a low average t-shirt at a good price.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Good quality, but not what I am used to with comfort colors
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
It seems like most people read an article about these t shirts, but had no previous experiences with them prior to their Amazon order.

This review is aimed at people who are used to the comfort colors college frat/sorority shirts.
These are not the same shirts. These, while still feel great quality, are not quite as thick or soft as what you will be used to. They also run smaller, so you might want to move to the next size if you don’t like a snug tight shirt. If I had bought these with no experience, I probably would have still rated 5 stars. Still a good quality shirt, but a little disappointed that they are not the same that I am used to. I did purchase another after receiving in a larger size and kept the old one, so they are still good shirts.

I wear t-shirts daily and in fact wear them out eventually.  I've been appalled at the cost of name brand t-shirts as well as the crappy quality.  Enter a NYT Wirecutter review that recommended these shirts.  I took the risk and as it turns out, wasn't a risk at all.  The shirts are solid in every regard.  Not a wimpy knit, but a nice medium weight for wearing most of the year.  They wash well and look good.  The black shirts and the white shirts are perfect.  The gray shirts are a solid gray, which I don't see often.  The above is all about the quality of the shirt.  Now the good part:  The shirts are a genuine bargain in terms of price alone.  I've paid four times the price for a 'designer' shirt, and this is a much better shirt, period.  Shipping was fast.  I do wish they had a "Tall" size, but the shirts still have a generous length to them.  Excellent quality and price.

items.title: Fruit of the Loom Eversoft Fleece Elastic Bottom Sweatpants with Pockets, Relaxed Fit, Moisture Wicking, Breathable

amazon_reviews.review_title: Great value! Good fit, quality, and comfort. Thick and warm. Great for cold temps. A++
amazon_reviews.review_comment: We like the fit, quality of materials used, comfort, and how warm it keeps us.  The waistband and drawstrings will ensure the sweatpants will fit snugly around your waist without falling or being too tight. We often will wear it in lieu of a pajama during cold evenings and around the house to save on heating bills.  Considering its price, we highly recommend this article of clothing.  A+

My husband and I are both 6ft tall. Since I’m tall I wear his crap all the time lol

We bought an XL and they are long and baggy, definitely not short or tight in anyway. We bought white and navy and black and none of them (including the white pair) are see through.

Husband weighs 250lbs
I weight 220lbs

For the price you can’t beat them! They are light but also very warm and soft inside. They are not brittle or cheap feeling, and if you can get them while they are on sale, EVEN BETTER!

Note: I originally purchased 3XLs due to our heights, and long legs (36”inseam), but they were TOO baggy and the drawstring couldn’t tighten them enough to keep them from falling to our ankles when we stood up lol.

Great for us tall people!!!!
These are good quality for the money but the sizes run big so it's hard to keep them up. But they are soft and seem to be durable.

Great fit, comfort, warmth, and price!  Why should you pay more for
another brand, when  these are such great sweatpants at a very reasonable price and quality?!

I'm 5'9 (woman) and the pants are a good length now, but I foresee them shrinking up more and more with time to too short of a length. Which is always my problem *sigh*
I like the color and slim-ish fit. The material is light to mid weight so can be worn almost year round. Hopefully the fabric holds up well; I don't expect issues.
Will likely buy again in other colors.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Not the same product as before
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I bought a couple pairs of this same sweatpants about 2years ago.  They say made in El Salvador on the tag.  They are perfect. A little extra room in the tush area.  I ordered a couple more pairs about 6 months ago. Not the same. Tag says made in Honduras.  No extra room in the back area. Extra room in the front area. They look and feel ridiculous.  I come back to order more today -  it says made in El Salvador on the Amazon page!!  so I think, maybe they just sent the wrong ones. Nope!!  The tag say made in Honduras !  They are the same wrong ones again. This time I’m send these back and just going to the store to see if I can find correct ones. Ridiculous!  Totally defeats the purpose of of reading the descriptions for the product.  So disappointed. These pants are not good if you are a women and have any kind of shape in your rear.  You will get plumbers crack.
It was the right size for me. Has large pockets. Very durable and I used them at physical therapy and they don't restrict my movement.

These are on the thinner side. They fit my husband well, but the drawstring is annoying (he had to cut it) and they are definitely not good for wearing outside on super cold days. They also pill really quickly. For the price though, they aren't bad.

I loved these pants when I got them, and I got four pairs of black.  Until I put them in my washing machine, all four of them inside out, so that the lint could wash out from the inside.  (inexpensive sweat pants have this lint that falls off)  The first problem was that the pants were so heavy when soaked up with water, that the washing machine took twenty minutes to spin instead of four: they were just clunking around heavy in the circle and not rinsing properly.  Then I had one pair of black that I washed with some other clothes, and everything took on the black color -- my white cotton socks all turned grey.  This was very sad because I really really liked these pants in every way: soft enough to sleep in, stylish enough to wear outside to the store, or anywhere.  Oh well.  So I returned them, and ordered some light Khaki Heather ones, two pairs medium, but they were never shipped, and a note on my phone said they could not be shipped because they don't take gift cards.  But the only size they have which ship quickly (not the 7 days of the other ones) were sized large and small, which I went ahead and ordered anyway: I will see if I can wear them, if not I will have to return them.  I'm really waiting for the medium ones, in beige heather, and repeated the order, and am waiting to see if they will ship.  The medium size ships a week later; the other sizes seem to be from a different place and ship overnight like they are supposed too.
Update:  I easily got a refund for all the black ones I returned, and my second order of Khaki Heather LARGE ones arrived: (I returned the SMALL as they were child-sized) I laundered them and the light color didn't ruin anything in the wash.  They are soft and comfortable, so nice, so I ordered 4 more of the Khaki Heather Large.  I love the light color.  They are long, but the elastic bottoms prevent the pants for sliding down and touching the floor.  The elastic bottoms are very gentle, you don't feel them at all.  These are the most comfortable sweats I have ever had, they are good to wear inside and out for errands, which I can not say about my other sweats.  I will order even more pairs. They do not shrink in the wash (maybe a tad only, but that's good), and as the color is Khaki Heather, the color does not ruin everything in the wash.  The black ones are the best, but be forewarned that you must launder them only with all other completely black clothes or towels.  If they are not good at first, they are very easy to return, and then order a size up or down.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Much improved over the last batch I bought!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
So, a few years ago I purchased a new set of Fruit of the Loom sweatpants and I was soooo disappointed.

I order Men’s Large because I want a very roomy fit and pockets.  Boy oh boy was I disappointed!  This was a few years ago but here’s a quick recap.  I ordered three pairs of Men’s Large and one pair fit like it was supposed to, one pair was too fitted in the tush area (I order big because I want baggy) and the third pair had such a short crotch that I could only wear them as hip huggers which makes them very uncomfortable.  I hesitated to wear them to the gym for fear of bending over and someone mistaking me for a plumber (if you know what I mean 😊!) . . .  Anyway, I don’t put my clothes thru the dryer (since my dryer broke) and one pair even split at the side seam just above the pocket.  So, I swore I would never buy FOTL sweatpants again.

Fast forward a few years later and guess what I did?  Yup – I bought three new pair and much to my surprise, these are all sized the same, are roomy & comfortable and most importantly, have adequate crotch length.  Maybe I just had a bad batch last time but it was ridiculous.  I’m satisfied with this new batch but my one observation is the tush area isn’t as generously proportioned as it used to be but the sweatpants are very comfortable nonetheless.  They have a drawstring waist so there is plenty of girth, wash up beautifully and have elastic at the ankle so no riding up the leg.  They are also super soft.

Would I buy them again, yes!  But I plan to keep these for a few more years if they are as durable as their predecessors.

items.title: The Children's Place Baby Family Matching, Fall Harvest Pajama Sets, Cotton

I am a modest person.

Very good quality. Better then targets Carter brand but very similar just better.

I love that the material isn't that thick but it's not too thin either which makes these the perfect fall themed pajamas!
Made good. Colorful. Fits great. I would probably up size when ordering again. Good product. Soft. No pockets. Cute fall pattern.

I got the 3t for my 2.5 year old daughter and they fit her just right. I got the size 6 for my 5.5 year old son and the pants are long which is great because he's tall. The shirt is definitely tight so a 7 would be more comfortable but it's fine. They are made to be more form fitting which isnt mine or my kids favorite but they look cute. I buy clothes direct from Childrens place all the time so I know their sizing.  But got these on amazon because it was available and cheaper.  I received a smaller pants than shirt, which I didn't notice until after washing.
But my child is very thin, so the smaller size normally isn't a problem.  He normally wears the size given anyways. I guess they shrunk alot because they are very tight and small compared to other pj's I've ordered.  So size up alot for big kids sizes.

These PJs ran long on my kids in the arms and legs and otherwise fit well. The sizes allowed me to get the matching sets for my 5, 3, and 1 year old. The comfort level of these PJs is similar to their old navy PJs. No complaints. The only downside was that the colors ran some when they were washed. If you have the time/knowledge to try to take care of this ahead of time, go for it before the stains set in like mine!

I got the skeleton pajamas for a work function. The pajamas were huge on me but very comfy. They did go in the dark, which was cool. I honestly didn’t even know that they glow in the dark. items.title: SHEWIN Womens Sweatshirt Casual Long Sleeve Lightweight Sweatshirts Button Loose Pullover Tops

This is a very comfortable top. I ordered a size large because I have very broad shoulders and I am glad I did. This leaves plenty of room around the body but it doesn’t look sloppy. It is very soft and warm! The temperature was in the low 50’s the day I wore it and I was comfortable. I got a couple of compliments on it that day. I am very happy with it!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Fit's true to size, which is not really loose, but I still like it.

Roomy, flattering, comfy! I got in white and blue. My blue one got water stains in the wash… why does this even happen!?!  So I threw it out - but I will def buy another one! Super flattering despite its relaxed versatility.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Do not go by size chart -- order normal size
