I would give this a 5 if the sleeves were longer in the large size. The XL is  too big but the sleeves fit. Overall a great sweatshirt.

items.title: Rain-X 810165 Latitude 2-In-1 Water Repellent Wiper Blades, 22 Inch Windshield Wipers (Pack Of 2), Automotive Replacement Windshield Wiper Blades With Patented Rain-X Water Repellency Formula

amazon_reviews.review_title: 🌧️ Rain-X Latitude 2-In-1 Water Repellent Wiper Blades | Ultimate Clarity & Performance! 🚗
amazon_reviews.review_comment: The Rain-X 5079279-2 Latitude 2-In-1 Water Repellent Wiper Blades (22 inches) are a game-changer for anyone looking to improve visibility and driving safety in rainy conditions. These wiper blades feature a patented Rain-X water repellency formula that helps rain bead up and roll off your windshield, giving you a clearer view with every swipe. The sleek, aerodynamic design reduces wind lift, while the advanced rubber blade ensures smooth, streak-free wiping, even at high speeds. Easy to install and built to last, these wipers are a must-have upgrade for your vehicle. Highly recommend for anyone who drives in wet weather! 🌧️💨

amazon_reviews.review_title: BEST Windshield Wipers on the Planet!!
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I have been using these for 6 years, and they last a good 3 years each set (if not longer).  The water beads right off your windshield.  These are far superior to even the most expensive windshield wipers you can buy.  "The technology that cause the water to bead" is fantastic and last for the life of the rubber on the windshield wiper.  I want to be clear.  It is not the "beading of water on the window"  that ultimately fails BUT the rubber of the windshield wiper (like all others) that eventually wears out.  The "water beading" feature lasts as long as the wiper itself lasts.  This "water beading" technology is what makes these windshield wipers standout from the competition.  They are also priced for a good value at about $19 a piece compared to $59 to $75 for a set for the supposedly best or most high-end priced ones.  My only complaint which is NOT with Rain-X but with Mercedes, is that Mercedes unnecessarily makes their windshield wiper connection more complex than it should be.  Instead of simple, they believe in complicated for everything.  It took me 20 minutes per wiper, cursing like a sailor to get these windshield wipers on the Mercedes arms / connectors.  The Mercedes's cars have an unnecessary retaining rod that interferes with the Rain-X attachment making it difficult to get them on.  Know that if you work with it long enough, you can get them on correctly without any modifications.  It is just a matter of angling the wipers just right to get them on correctly.  However, it is well worth it as these windshield wipers are far, far superior to the best competitors brand at likely half the price.  I rate A++.
Easy install and cleans the windshield really well.

Easy installation as per usual with Rain-X wipers, but even following the directions didn't help avoid streaks in my windhsield.

The driver side wiper works as expected, the passenger side leaves many streaks and makes the windshield visibility worse.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Fits front windshield of 2018 Mazda CX-5
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Amazon states these Rain-X 810164 Latitude 2-In-1 24" and 18" wiper blades do not fit my 2018 Mazda CX-5 touring vehicle, which has the narrow push button connectors, but they DO!! After taking off the supplied connector cover and adapters, they clicked right in. Now, unfortunately, this same style wiper blade in the 14" does not work with the rear windshield of my Mazda as the connector for that wiper blade is a Rock Lock 2 rear arm connection. These wiper blades do not fit the Rock Lock 2 rear arm connectors. As far as performance, it just snowed for the first time this year and these wiper blades did very well!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Confused on why amazon says these are not compatible with my car
amazon_reviews.review_comment: These blades are very compatible with a 2021 chevy Trax. I currently have them on my car and they work like a dream. I just re ordered them for my car, one is a 26 inch and the other is a 14 inch. I even looked it up through Google and they are very compatible with my car, and yes they do fit very nicely and they work great. So I have no clue what Amazon's issue is by telling me they will not work or fit when in actuality they honestly really do fit and work great. Don't go by what amazon says, look it up through the manufacturer of your vehicle and also do further research because through GM, I can use these blades. So get the lead out of your ass amazon and give correct information on car parts.

Ok...like some others said, the clip is hard to open. After opening the clip and removing the old wiper, I tried to install and close the clip. Not happening. After several tries..and about to give up, I got it. I had to pull back on the arm until it clicked in the slot. The second wiper blade took all of one minute to install. The blades are quiet and do a great job. Amazon had the best price I could find, and they were recommended by Car and Driver.

Ok, this was the BIGGEST pain. I 100% got the right size for my 2020 Honda Accord, 26" for the left, 16" for the right. I am a capable, intelligent, adult woman. I have installed my fair share of windsheild wipers in my 45 years, in the rain, in the dark, at the gas station, in front of the auto parts store,  on the side of the road, in the rain, without a flashlight.
I purchased these, left and right to replace my set that was very far gone, due to summertime and sap.
So, last evening I attempted to install them, ahead of today's rain storm. I followed the directions, not great directions, but I understood them. The tab would NOT click closed. I could NOT have pushed harder without breaking them and my fingers hurt. So, It was clear to me that the J hook need to be seated further inside the housing...
So ok. I tried and TRIED to seat the J hook further into the blade housing. There was NO budging. I tried multiple times on BOTH sides. I  put enough pressure and force into it that I was afraid I was going to bend or break the metal arm, the part attached to my car. I actually gave up, a first for me. I figured I would revisit the issue in the morning with fresh eyes and fingers. But the rain was coming, and today was an important day, so it HAD to get done. It's just wiper blades, for heavens sake. I didn't doubt that I could do it. BUT, I tried again, and AGAIN. I called my ex for advice. I watched videos. I double checked that I had the right size. Well, I ended up having to borrow a friend's car to take my kid to school. I came back home, I tried AGAIN, nope.
I had to cancel on a dear friend who desperately need my support in court. THIS is what I am most upset about.
So, I read Amazon reviews looking for insight, I watched YouTube videos, Rain X website videos. I desperately tried EVERYTHING so I could show up for my friend. FINALLY, (but way too late to help my friend) I found a post on reddit from some wonderful man who said if the j hooks don't fit down far enough to snap the closure shut, and no amount of force is pushing it down, you have to remove the black outer casing to expose the three holes on the side and use a small screwdriver to force the J hook far enough in to allow the tab to snap shut. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? So, yeah I got to work. Well, it worked, thank the Lord above.
But, by this time it's already 5pm, court is over and its dark, damp and cold... THEN I found out it's a bad idea to run Rain X wipers over dirty glass. Its due to rain in an hour! My kid has school tomorrow and I have to go to work, turns out, windsheild wipers are IMPORTANT. Just saying. So....Great. AND you have to run them at medium speed for 2 to 3 minutes on DRY, CLEAN glass at the moment of installation. Wonderful. I have a pine tree above my driveway that shares lots of its sap with me. So, I wash the windsheild with soap and water, rince, dry, use a razor blade for the drops of sap, wipe away any traces of sap with rubbing alcohol, final rinse, and dry with a microfiber cloth.
Ok, I remove the yellow protective case around the blades, lower them, lovingly, onto my sparkling clean and dry windsheild, turn the car on, run the wipers on the dry windsheild at medium speed for 3 minutes, then add the final splash of water. I got back in the car to check out my handiwork, turn the wipers on and WITH EVERY SWIPE OF THE BLADES there is a haze that lasts for a couple seconds. Not a problem, IF you're just swiping away a little water or using low speed. However, if you are using high speed wipers, the temporary haze doesn't go away fast enough before the next swipe. WONDERFUL, because yes, I went through all that so that I could drive around in a rainstorm with a windsheild I CANT SEE OUT OF.
I am so very displeased, I never thought that, in my life, I would have such an issue and have so many problems because of WINDSHIELD WIPER BLADES. This is ridiculous, writing this review is ridiculous, and probably a fat waste of my time, but honestly, I'm MAD enough that I don't care. WHAT is the deal with over complicated wiper blades? WHY is there an outer shell, an inner blue piece, and so many different ways to configure it, but no actual way to USE it without finding a person on Reddit to tell you how??? I 100% did everything right. I even had my friend try to put the wipers on, he couldn't do it either.
I'll give two stars, instead of one, for this reason: I should have bought new blades before winter and before it was totally necessary. I'm willing to take responsibility for that. I also should have done more research, you know, kinda like a "stupid" tax that I have to pay, if I wasn't busy with kids, and career, and LIFE. I guess I should have found the time to research these blades so that I WOULDN'T have bought them.
The dirty windsheild, the sap.. ok thats MY problem. I should have done more research into Rain X. The fact of the matter is, I just wanted wiper blades to wipe the water away. I assumed a name brand set was a good idea, but I didn't put much thought into what Rain X was. My fault. I didn't know that the blades have a coating of Rain X that makes a mess, another "stupid" tax. And that it has to be properly prepped (not that proper preparation did me the slightest bit of good) I dont know... did I miss a step? I just thought it was a brand. My bad.
In the past, depending on the circumstances of my wiper needs, I always either just bought Bosch, or a store brand and just put them on the stinking car!
Nonsense. Never again. Overly complicated, difficult and very disappointing results, once these blades are either worn out, or prove to be a hazard due to not being able to SEE, I am anticipating having to strip the product off of my windsheild with some chemical. I'll probably find help for that issue on Reddit.
I just want to say that once I had finally found someone to tell me how to get enough leverage to forcibly shove the j hook in the wipers far enough to lock them in place, (without damaging my car)  and gathered all my tools, it took me 40 minutes, start to finish to install and prep the windsheild with wholly disappointing results. I will reiterate here that I am a very capable woman, installing wiper blades is way below my pay grade. I'm obviously irritated. And NOW, I will be even MORE irritated tomorrow, when I drive to work, in a rainstorm, and can't see out of my windsheild. TOTAL Garbage.

You can buy whatever brand you want but they're all going to last about the same amount of time. Run them across ice or peel them off a windshield when they're frozen to it and they're all going to tear about the same. Unless you go up to the crazy expensive ones there's no reason to spend a ton of money on these things. It's just too bad so many of them are sold as singles now but I guess it's because there are so many different options that you might end up with a two-pack where only one fits. So I guess that's the compromise. But for the cheap brands these are the ones to get.

I needed a new wiper blade on the passenger side which was smaller than anything my nearby store had in stock so I ordered this one mainly because it was identical to the longer drivers side I picked up previously.  These go on very easily and stay put better than the more inexpensive products.  This was quickly shipped and swell packaged.  Very satisfied.

items.title: Drift Car Air Freshener - Wood Air Freshener - Car Odor Eliminator - Amber Scent Starter Kit

amazon_reviews.review_title: Best Car Freshener I've had in years.
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I recently purchased this car air freshener, and I couldn't be happier with my choice! The installation process was a breeze—literally took me just a minute to clip it onto the vent.

What I love most about this air freshener is its scent. It has a strong, pleasant fragrance that effectively eliminates any unpleasant odors in the car, but it’s not overpowering at all. It creates a nice, refreshing atmosphere without being overwhelming, which can sometimes be the case with other products.

Overall, I highly recommend this air freshener to anyone looking to freshen up their vehicle. It's convenient, effective, and has just the right amount of fragrance. Definitely a five-star product!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Stylish Air Freshener with a Pleasant Amber Scent
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I recently bought the Drift Car Air Freshener - Amber Scent Starter Kit, and overall, I’m quite pleased with it! The wooden design is unique and looks great hanging in my car, adding a touch of style that most air fresheners don’t offer. It’s a nice change from the typical bulky, plastic air fresheners.

The amber scent is warm and pleasant—not overpowering, but just enough to make the car smell fresh without being overwhelming. It’s a subtle, sophisticated fragrance that doesn’t feel artificial or overly sweet like some other air fresheners.

The installation was incredibly easy, and I like that it's made of wood, which adds an eco-friendly touch. After a couple of weeks, the scent is still noticeable, though it has faded a bit faster than I expected. I’m giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because I wish the scent lasted longer, but it’s still a solid product.

If you’re looking for a stylish, subtle air freshener that adds a nice scent without taking over the whole car, this is a great choice. I’ll likely try other scents from Drift in the future.

Pros:

Stylish wooden design
Pleasant amber scent
Easy to install
Cons:

Scent could last longer
Overall, a great addition to my car!

Not long lasting, but lovely. I like that the wood could be replaced and it didn't smell as harsh as other air vent fresheners I've used, but I'm sad it died so quickly. The amber smell was powerful for a few days then dropped off to about nothing by about a week. I'm not convinced it is worth the cost.

Okay, so I gave this two stars because it is indeed beautiful, it holds well, and it doesn't get in the way and the worry of it falling onto your face or the dash as you drive is non existent.

This thing came in packaged well, I was impressed by Alpha Males review on it so I decided to give it a try, and I bought two of them. One for the driver and passenger side.

I installed them on Saturday, the scent was very strong, I see other reviews of people saying just how powerful the scent is and it is true, it's a powerful scent, however, it is right in front of your face as you drive and with the AC on or Heat on will further blow it into your face.

Now, as I said, I installed it on Saturday and by Monday the smell was so faint that I forgot that I had installed them.

Comes Tuesday, zero scent, I was so disappointed. I questioned myself to see if I had done something wrong, and I followed the instructions that I came with them and I also watched videos on them.

Now, I am not sure if it starts off strong and then just supposed to lightly scent your vehicle, because I don't even smell it when I open the door and get in after the door has been closed all night.

Maybe I received bad ones? But what are the chances of receiving two bad ones?

Even before writing this review I went to my car to see if I was able to smell anything and it was so little that it didn't make sense at all.

I think they have a great product here, it looks beautiful within the car, but they need to do more quality checks on this product.

Now, they get you by saying that it can last up to 30 days ... But how? What makes it last 30 days?
What would make it not smell after 48 hours?

I bought thr Amber scent for my car. I love how compact the air freshener is, and how the metal clip just attaches to my sun visor. The air freshener itself has a small magnetic to keep it in place. I bought mine back in July, and it still has a fragrance. If you're looking for a air freshener for your car then I would recommend this.
First impression was like - oh no, it has a Christmas smell, and not what I was looking for, but after one day being in the car, it changed and now it’s like very expensive perfume.

I use it for my truck, everytime I drive it smells so good and not just a faint smell. It's easy to to use just put it on your visor and that's it I also love the size and that is not just hanging in my rear view mirror.

These are pretty impressive. The smell is very strong at first but lasts weeks. I just slipped it inside the holder and when the smell started to ease pulled it out and it smelled new again  I personally didn’t love the smell but a woman accidentally got in the wrong car and sat in mine lol. She apologized and told me my car smells great. So it does the job.  These are pretty cute blocks of wood. Who knew it was an air freshener.
It really smells good.  Different from other site fresheners.  Strong at first and can’t be adjusted.  But smells very good.
The scent is okay. The only issue is when using the visor the scent block falls off. I used double sided tape to keep it in place.

items.title: CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit – Guaranteed To Last As Long As You Own Your Vehicle – Brings Headlights back to Like New Condition - 3 Easy Steps - No Power Tools Required

amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I can’t say enough good things about the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit! My headlights had become cloudy and dull over the years, making my car look older than it is. I was skeptical about how much of a difference this product would make, but wow—I’m blown away!

The entire process took me only 20 minutes, and the results are incredible. My headlights now look brand new, crystal clear, and shiny. It not only improves the car’s appearance but also enhances visibility at night, which is a huge bonus.

The instructions were easy to follow, and everything I needed was included in the kit. It’s a simple, cost-effective solution compared to replacing or professionally restoring headlights. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking to refresh their car’s look quickly and effortlessly!

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I used the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit on my 2007 Toyota Avalon, and I am thoroughly impressed with the results. This kit is a game-changer for anyone looking to restore their vehicle’s headlights to like-new condition without the need for power tools.

Easy to Use: The kit is incredibly user-friendly, with just three simple steps to follow. The instructions are clear and straightforward, making the process quick and hassle-free. Even if you’re not particularly handy, you’ll have no trouble using this kit.

No Power Tools Required: One of the best features is that no power tools are needed. This makes the kit accessible to everyone, regardless of their experience with car maintenance. The included materials are more than sufficient to get the job done effectively.

Impressive Results: The results are nothing short of amazing. My headlights went from cloudy and yellowed to crystal clear. The difference in visibility at night is significant, and my car looks much newer as a result. The ceramic coating provides a long-lasting finish that keeps the headlights looking great.

Durability: The kit promises results that last as long as you own your vehicle, and I can see why. The ceramic coating is durable and resistant to future oxidation and yellowing. This gives me confidence that I won’t need to repeat the process anytime soon.

Value for Money: Considering the professional-quality results, this kit offers excellent value for money. It’s much more affordable than replacing the headlights or paying for professional restoration services.

Safe and Effective: The kit is designed to be safe for use on all types of headlights. The materials are high-quality and effective, ensuring that the restoration process doesn’t damage the headlights in any way.

In summary, the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit is an outstanding product that delivers on its promises. It’s easy to use, requires no power tools, and provides long-lasting, professional-quality results. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to restore their headlights and improve their vehicle’s appearance and safety.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Works amazingly well. Far exceeded my expectations.
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I’m probably like you, and figured, yeah, they say it’s going to do all these great things and it’ll probably not work anywhere near as advertised. Oh boy was I wrong about that.

This product is quite frankly amazing. It’s very easy to use and doesn’t take hours and hours. Everything you need is in the kit except masking tape, which I would highly recommend you use to tape off the perimeter of your light so you don’t get any of the coating on your car paint or accidentally hit it with the sand paper.

You first use the oxidizer remover, wipe and clean that off, then you go to the 1000 and 2000 grit sanding discs. Get a good spray bottle with nice clean water, keep the headlight wet while you’re sanding it because basically what you’re doing is wet sanding the surface. You can actually feel the sandpaper, engaging the scratches, and when you finally have a nice smooth, feel to it, spray it down and wipe it off and clean it with a microfiber cloth. Then apply the coating. When you apply the coating, it is literally a miracle. How perfect and clean and clear the lens becomes. It looks brand freaking new!

I literally was walking around the garage looking at it saying “damn that looks good“, damn that looks good! You will not be disappointed. This is one of the best products to come around in a long, long time and is worth every penny. I even had a little extra left over and did my cub cadet headlight cover.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Very very good, but not quite five star
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I purchased this kit based on Youtube reviews and the fact they offer a lifetime warranty.

I removed both head lights so I could work on them on my work bench.

The "step 1" oxidation removing pads are nothing short of amazing.  I almost stopped there.  But I continued with the 2000 and 3000 wet sanding pads.

Results are shown in the pics.

I would give this a "four star" review.

I think I should have spent more time on the wet sanding.  The headlights look great from a few feet, but if one looks closely, one can still see some scratches and fogging.  If I had had to do it all over again, I would put the wet sanding pads on a buffer or something of the like and let the power tool do some of the work.  I think this would elevate the result to "five star".

In short, great product, but I do recommend taking more time wet sanding and/or using a buffer or something of the like during the "step 2" wet sanding process.

amazon_reviews.review_title: It's almost like magic, it's unbelievable...
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
This product works so well, the amount of effort and time you spend on it is far exceeded by the results, it's almost like magic. Look at my before and after pictures and see for yourself.

The headlights I used this on were oxidized, I normally use headlight polish on it every month or so to clear it up but it takes a lot of effort, the results aren't amazing and it only lasts a month. The before pictures show the extent of it after a complete wash and wipe down with isopropyl alcohol. The instructions were clear, though I did notice one typo, it mentions to use a red sanding pad followed by gray, but my kit came with red and green, I just assumed green for gray and it was fine.

Obviously the amount of time and effort you spend will depend on the size of your headlight and how intricate it is, headlights with intricate complex shapes and reliefs popping out will be annoying, you'll have to use the sandpaper by itself without the foam grip and fold it and spend a lot of time on edges and corners. In addition to the instructions I highly recommend you mask off the entire surrounding area with painter's tape, make sure you fold the painter's tape over and into the gap between the headlight and the bumper or fender.

The nail biting part is at the end when you're applying the clear coat, you obviously don't want to mess it up, you're undoubtedly going to notice you missed a tiny spot, despite the directions saying not to go over it in multiple passes, I did it anyway and it turned out fine, you just want to do it quickly before it has time to set. The clear coat is legit sorcery, it self levels, I even saw a few tiny air bubbles and those all disappeared, after an hour it was dry and the finish not only looked 100% clear, it was completely free of defects and texturing, it literally (and I can't emphasize this enough) looked like a brand new headlight. I would expect a clear coat applied with a small gauze pad to be uneven, have visible strokes in it (like brush strokes), instead it's completely level with no marks and has no texture whatsoever, when I rub my fingers over it the surface feels shiny, reflective, slippery, like a new headlight. The result was so good I kept staring at it for over ten minutes at all angles, I was in awe.

Time will tell how long it will last, if it even lasts a year I'll be happy. From now on I'm never polishing headlights again, I wax them with a non-abrasive wax to keep them clean but once they (eventually) oxidize to the point of cloudiness, it's time for this kit.

The pictures show driver's side "before" (I didn't take a picture of passenger side "before" but it looked the same), then an after shot for both driver and passenger side.

Some things about the before shot:
1. To some this may look like light oxidation because you can still somewhat see through it, that oxidation is actually lighter than it normally would be, because it hasn't been that long since I last polished it with headlight polish. Had I left it for a few more months it would have become totally opaque.
2. If you're wondering on the before shot why there's a sharp line/termination toward the top where it becomes completely clear, that's where the hood sits and blocks the UV from the sunlight, think of it like a farmer's tan.

Decided to give this a try and bought a few kits when they were on sale. Product was easy to use and provides you with everything that is needed. I was able to restore and make the headlamps look almost new. Product is easy to use and takes about 30 min from start to finish. I ended up using it on 2 vehicles. In all honesty they seem to provide more than what is needed. I probably could have done 2 vehicles with 1 set. I didn't want to risk it so I applied 1 set per vehicle. Results came out great, hoping it lasts.

Super easy to apply. The first step is just taking the step 1 wipes and wiping off all the nasty stuff that has built up over the years. The second step is sanding off all the stuff that the step one wipes didn't remove. The 3rd step is where the magic happens. If you watch the video from the maker of the wipes you will think it is fake but it is not!!!! It made my head light lenses look just as good as new. Plus, when I went to work the next morning (2:30 am) the beam from the headlights were so clear and crisp. I love this product!!!! I just applied it 3 weeks ago so I can't tell you if it will last the life of the vehicle like they claim. But even if it lasts 6 months, it is so cheap and easy to do, it's worth it. I 100% recommend using this product.

amazon_reviews.review_title: THIS is the kit to buy
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I needed to restore 11yr old headlights to pass safety inspection. I did the home remedy of baking soda & WD40. Not good enough. Then I tried 2 different meguiar products - good enough to pass inspection but not great. Then I tried THIS product & wish I'd only done this one! Crystal clear headlights.

Pros:
-  Easy to follow instructions.
-  Tidy. Each part is "use & toss" so you don't have to store remaining product.
-  It comes with everything except water (spray bottle or a cup of water) and a couple clean rags.
-  The sandpaper part is easy to do, even for a non-DIY person.
-  Even if you mess up, it's not that bad.
-  You really can get this done in 20 minutes.

Cons
-  You shouldn't drive your car for at least 60 minutes after so the stuff can dry.
(This probably should have be true on the other products, but I don't remember reading that.)

I think what makes this kit perform better are the multiple cleaning wipes & the right sandpaper. And the quality of the instructions.

The benefit of using 3 different kits & a home remedy means I can confirm I didn't have to sacrifice quality for ease of use. This stuff is good.

Anyways, I realize I'm adding to the 47K great reviews which probably isn't necessary. But I'm just a regular person trying a DIY solution to a problem and it worked great!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Complete transformation to new looking lights
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
This is my second time using this product. It lasted about three years the last time I did it. Same car,  (2013) same lights. If you have never done this, let me clue you out on what you should expect.
Step one is pretty easy, you apply the chemical with the included pad over your lights to remove the surface level oxidation. It’s part of the surface prep, and will not impress you in terms of the results. But it’s only step one.
Step two, prepare to feel like you are destroying your lights. Using a spray bottle with water and the provided sandpaper, you will begin to sand the surface of your lights. They are not going to become clear, they are going to look like you’ve sanded them, to the point of oblivion. White, cloudy, destroyed, this is how they’re going to look in step two. The purpose is to get them smooth, not clear. A lot of goo is going to come off of your lights during this phase, you might be sanding for 20 or 30 minutes to get them ready. But eventually, you will reach a consistent level of smoothness. The sandpaper is a very light grit, so you will not be destroying your lights, it’s just going to look like you are :-).
Step three, you might want to film this because it’s very satisfying. Once everything is clean and dry, you’re going to apply the step three application with one wipe in an overlapping manner.
The cloudiness will immediately disappear, and while you will think this is clear only because it is still wet— prepare to be amazed.
In about 15 seconds, your lights are completely restored, and now they just need to dry. The clarity will not go away, they will still look wet in an hour or weeks from now. All of the work in steps one and two are required to achieve the results in step three, you really need to follow the directions to get amazing results.
I recommend applying some painters tape around your lights so the sandpaper does not scratch your paint while you are moving it around. I also recommend using a lot of water while sanding, so you can see your progress easier. It’s a messy prep process so you might want to have some paper towels on hand.
The first time I did this process, it took me over an hour, because I had never done it before. This last time it took about 35 minutes for both lights.
My results, while  impressive, are not permanent. Lights wear out, so I would not expect this to be a one time project. Like I said, this was my second time on this car, but three years is excellent resilience.

Once you notice cloudy headlights, You can’t unsee them. They make a car look so old, and are bad for nighttime driving. Conversely, when you apply this product, your headlights are going to look like you just bought them, your entire car looks newer, just from clearing  the headlights. The whole product is cheaper than a car wash, but dramatically improves your vehicles appearance, and improves safety for nighttime driving as well.

I recommend for any vehicle, or as a gift for friends or family because it’s a nice project that most people would enjoy doing.

Sorry I didn’t take a before picture, but the after image speaks for itself. Clear lights like new!

This project was very satisfying, Positive vibes :-)

I purchased this headlight restoration kit as my last of multiple attempts at fixing the horrible situation with both headlights on my 2015 Chevy Traverse LTZ, which is supposed to be the top trim for this model. Every car like this one I see in the street has this exact same problem: yellow, crusty, glazed headlights that are hard to ignore and just make the whole car look awful. I've tried toothpaste, bug repellent, buffing, none of it lasted more than a few hours.

So I got this kit and took multiple before-pictures because I've been long waiting for this moment. The reviews showed dozens of miracle restoration to headlights in worse condition.

Instructions are straightforward, though I misread the instructions and repeated the steps by sanding with the first pads again, instead of using the second ones, so I ended up sanding twice as long. Because of that, I did the same and double-sanded with the second set of pads.

My husband came in for moral support because I was really nervous about ruining my lights. He reassured me that it would all work out. It did!

The instructions state that the entire headlights should be cloudy (not clear) after sanding is completed. That was not the case for me; even after sanding twice as long across the entire surface, the plastic that had no sun damage was still intact and clear after rinsing. So I moved on to the next step.

The damage is mostly along the “eyelids” so I spent a little extra time in the damaged areas which were rough, until they felt smooth.

After drying them with a clean towel, I waited an hour before applying the ceramic clear coating. I used only 1 pad for both headlights; it was very wet and soaked in liquid. The instructions said to use 1 pad for each headlight, but also stated that less is better and to not leave the surface soaked.

The passenger headlight had condensation from driving over every single puddles in heavy rain to entertain my kids in the backseat (not doing that again), so it looks worse in the Before pictures. It's all gone in the After pictures, which are taken a week after restoration. The winner is the driver side.

Overall, this product has far exceeded my expectations.

items.title: AstroAI Tire Inflator Portable Air Compressor Tire Air Pump for Car Tires - Car Accessories, 12V DC Auto Pump with Digital Pressure Gauge, Emergency LED Light for Bicycle, Balloons, Yellow

amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I've had a Slime Home Air Station (120 volt only) for many years, but the hose recently failed and couldn't be repaired, so it was time to find a replacement. This piece meets the need. It seems well-made and comes with a useful User Manual. However, it IS quite different from what I had before.

First off, it's 12 volt only, via a standard auto 12V  socket. The User Manual said to start the car's engine while using it, so I'm guessing it draws a fair amount of current and might flatten your battery with prolonged use. The inflator hose is also much shorter than what I was used to, but still long enough to reach the valve-stem at the 12 o'clock position while the compressor remains on the ground. It's a bonus that it stays put when it's running and doesn't skate across the surface, as my old unit did.

The built-in digital pressure gauge is easy to read, but reads about 2.5 PSI over actual pressure as checked by a separate calibrated  pressure gauge. Actual 35 PSI reads 37.5 PSI on this unit. Not really a big deal. If you can make change, you can do the math.

The best feature is the Auto-stop at a preset pressure. My old unit did not have this, so I had to stare at the gauge for several minutes as the needle slowly crept up the dial. On this one, just set the desired pressure and start the compressor. The digital pressure gauge shows inflation progress 0.5 PSI at a time. When it hits the preset setting, it shuts off within a few seconds. My car has 235/55ZR20 tires and this unit will raise the pressure from 32 PSI to 38 PSI in about 3 minutes; not as fast as having a tank-type 120 volt 150 PSI compressor, but certainly acceptable for an occasional-use compact 12 volt unit. I paid less than $30 for this one with next day delivery, so I think qualifies as a great value. Highly recommended.

I don’t typically leave reviews. But this item has saved me a lot of time, hassle, and money. I love that all you have to do is set the psi and it automatically shuts off. Fills fairly quick. I’m very happy with this purchase! The only (slight) cons are: it only has a lighter plug, no wall plug, and you have to be quick when you remove the air hose. Otherwise you’ll seep air out of your tire quick. Other than that, it’s a great product.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Lightweight and Reliable Compressor with a Few Quirks
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I recently purchased this small compressor, and overall, I’m quite satisfied with its performance. It’s lightweight, compact, and very easy to use. The long cord is a big plus, allowing me to connect it easily and move around my Jeep. The pressure indicator seems accurate, which is a critical feature when inflating tires.

Pros:

Lightweight and compact design makes it easy to store and handle.

Long cord provides excellent reach, especially for larger vehicles like a Jeep.

Accurate pressure indicator for reliable readings.

Cons:

The connector occasionally slips out of the cigarette lighter socket during use, which can be a bit annoying.

After about 10 minutes of use, the connector and hose become quite hot, which might raise durability concerns with prolonged operation.

Real-world performance:
I tested the compressor on my Jeep's 225/65R17 tires, inflating them from 19 PSI to 35 PSI. Each tire took about 4–5 minutes to inflate. After an off-road trip, it took approximately 20 minutes to restore all four tires to road-ready pressure. While this isn't lightning-fast, it’s efficient enough for the occasional off-road enthusiast.

Overall:
This compressor is a solid choice for light to moderate use, especially for off-roaders or anyone needing a portable option. A few minor issues aside, it gets the job done reliably.

I thought that the 12v power cord and the air hose itself was too short to reach the rear wheels of a vehicle. I expressed this design oversight to the seller. They offered me compensation for my inconvenience. I am very pleased with their most excellent customer service and concern with my overall satisfaction. With that said, this is a very decent and adequate emergency air pump to keep in your car. It is compact and easy to use. It has a built in air gauge that helps you pump your tire to a precise pressure. I recommend everyone carry a device like this for road side emergencies.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Best purchase on Amazon maybe ever
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Backed out of the garage one day last week, front tire was soft and I stopped at 2 nearby gas stations that had air. Both of them were out of order. Decided right then that it was time to get one of these. This came same day. It's great! Easy to use and way faster than I expected it to be. My tire was down to 19 and it got it up to 32.5 in less than 3 minutes. I had expected it to take maybe 3x that long. The cord is long enough to reach all my tires (I went ahead and did all 4 because I could). It's great to have the peace of mind knowing I have my own air station. I'm buying one for the other vehicle and they'll just stay in the trunk. And I bet in the spring it will work for my wheelbarrow tires too. Highly recommend, I haven't found any negatives to this device.

I purchased my first small portable car tire inflator over 50 years ago and believe it or not it still works only problem is all the rubber hoses have rotted. I also have three others that are still close to the same age and they too still work. I have to attribute that to all of the 4 inflators were made in the USA. However, they did have one flaw and that is they were very slow to bump up a large tire that was totally unflated

When I saw the Black Friday sale on these compressors and all the positive reviews as decided to purchase one for my wife's Toyota Sequoia. Also decided that it would be best if she learned how to use the little compressor before a real need arised. Since our weather recently changed and it's gotten cooler all the tires were reading low so she went around bringing the pressure up on all four tires from 3 to 8 pounds. We were both surprised how quickly the little compressor topped the tires off and shut off at the set air pressure. Just to be sure I check the pressure with a gauge and they were right on.

The electrical cord with a cigarette lighter adapter was completely adequate to reach all four tires using the outlet on the dash. The Sequoia has other outlets but I wanted to see if the the one would take care of all four tires and it did. The inflator is small and light and took up very little storage space in the rear compartment under the deck for items such as this.

Presently we are completely pleased with the purchase, in fact I purchased two more for Christmas gifts. My only concern is the longevity of this Chinese made product. Quite frankly it appears that obsolescence comes quickly to most of the goods that are coming out of China. This concerns me greatly when I give a gift to be used in an emergency that by the time the emergency happens it may be of no use.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Works great for tires under 50 PSI.
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I bought this because we have the yellow version at work. It claims it can do up to 90 PSI, but in practice it can BARELY make it to 80 (which we have Chevy Express vans at work that need 88 PSI), so not the best application at my workplace. HOWEVER, my personal vehicle needs the tires pressured to 35 PSI, and for that it works wonderfully. Easy to program to the proper PSI, and can switch to metric for those in other parts of the world. It also comes with attachments for balls and bike tires as well. Overall decent product for the price point.

Size is small and light, really easy to store away in your car. Great quality and there is no air leak when pumping air in your tire or anything that needs air. The accuracy of the psi is spot on, I am satisfied. Thank you.

My car sits outside and we had a cold snap the other night.  So when I went to start the car I found my battery had gone flat.  This happened to me early this year too, so I had purchased a jump starter that was a huge lifesaver for me.  I jump start the car, only to find my tires had also gotten very low with the cold temperatures.  This also happened to me on Christmas Eve last year when I lived further north.  At that time I had to get towed, which wasn't the best time for it to happen, and also pretty costly.  I hopped on here and looked for something I could use to inflate my tires that would be as effective and handy as my jump starter, landing on this little beauty.  Yes, I had to wait a couple of days for delivery, but thankfully as I am semi-retired, and work from home, I didn't have to be anywhere urgently.
I also purchased the DC adapter as I thought it would be better than draining my car battery as we have low temps forecast again.  I hooked it up and away we went.  All four tires inflated to their correct level and I was good to go!  For such a small, inexpensive, piece of equipment, I was very pleased.  I would definitely recommend getting this (as well as a jump starter) for those times they are needed.
I had previously purchased what I hoped would be an effective, small, handy dandy tool (Norshire) which cost 3x+ as much, but proved to be quite useless as it died (burnt out) after a couple of uses.

Must have tire inflator. Must better than cordless. Does not need to be charged, just plus in your car. Comes with tips to fill air for for bike tires, balls, car tires and anything else that needs air. East to operate. Just plus in, attach the end to fill air and turn on. Set how much air needs to be filled. My car tires were at 18. I set it for 32. It took just about a minute to fill. You do need step on it to hold in place. Otherwise it will vibrate and jump around a bit. Super useful. Also comes with a bight flashlight. Price it unbeatable compared to others. I have used this brand before and have always been satisfied with the purchase.

items.title: USANOOKS Microfiber Cleaning Cloth Grey - 12 Pcs (12.5"x12.5") - High Performance - 1200 Washes, Ultra Absorbent Microfiber Towel Weave Grime & Liquid for Streak-Free Mirror Shine - Car Washing Cloth

amazon_reviews.review_comment: I found these to be a good value. I have purchased several other brands of microfiber towels. These are the thickest and softest of those that I have tried.  They work beautifully on our stainless appliances. They also make a difference detailing the inside of our car. I got the gray and love that color option as it does not show any dirt and after washing they look brand new.

I love these small cloths. I use them in the kitchen and bathrooms to wipe up water on the countertops. They are very absorbent. The small size is great for small jobs. They wash and dry easily. They are soft and the gray color is a bonus for me.

These are fantastic absorbers and incredibly useful around the house, workplace, and even in your car. They’re super soft and do a great job of hiding dirt until it’s time to wash them. Highly recommended!

—Koorosh

These are good quality. I received these yesterday and one of the packages only had 11 towels instead of 12. I used them this morning to wash 2 SUV’s. 12 towels did one car. I have larger towels but wanted to see how these smaller towels would work. I think I like a larger towel better but these did work well.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Durable & Lint Free. Ultra Absorbent. Perfect For All Cleaning Projects
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The first one out of the package had me impressed. I didn't think it would be so absorbent even after reading all the comments, but this product definitely lives up to its reputation. I purchased the cloths in grey, mostly because of the price difference and I was going to give it a try. After the first week, I'm sold. This product does everything it claims and more. I just took apart the stove, cleaned under the coils and now it's spotless. No streaks and cleaning was a breeze. I've never before been so impressed. Now I'm getting ready to thoroughly clean the refrigerator and the cars and I don't worry that these cloths will fall apart. They're not too thin & not too thick. I'm 65 and I sincerely appreciate the thickness as I have some difficulty wringing out wash cloths with my hands due to arthritis. No problem with these, best of all they don't scratch or shed.

I hope this review helps with your decision. I'm so happy I found a quality product at a very affordable price and you will too!
A very good product for cleaning monitors, phone screens, ETC. Good price, too.
Easy for cleaning windows and cars. Easy to clean and lint free. Not very thick but still works great.
Good quality, easy to clean and plenty of them incase see you mess one up. Great value

I bought these to do a waterless wash/wax on my car. Honestly, I was a bit underwhelmed when I opened the package and saw how thin these were. Having said that, they work VERY well. The thickness (or thinness?) did not effect it's performance. I used 6 of them (3 wet, 3 dry) on the whole car and would have 6 more to spare, if needed. I'll throw them in the washer and do it over again in a month. Great value.

I misread the product titile and expected them to be bigger but they are great for small cleanups for details or cleaning a area before a new part goes in or plenty of other stuff that I've cleaned in the kitchen.

at the end of the day, it is just a microfiber towel so its nothing special but it works and its cheaper then what i can find in stores so i love it

items.title: Chemical Guys SPI22016 Total Interior Cleaner and Protectant, Safe for Cars, Trucks, SUVs, Jeeps, Motorcycles, RVs & More, 16 fl oz

amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I've been an avid detailer for 30 years.  And I do love the chemicals aspect of it.  I've tried many products, and the vast majority of them aren't very good.  Mind you, I was starting out detailing back in the 80's, when you had a VERY limited amount of products to rely on (And yes, I remember the very first days of Armor-All when it would CRACK your dash.. Those days are, of course, long gone.
But I have been a big fan of Chemical Guy's products, and have written many reviews on here about their other products.
This Total Interior, I have to say, has met or exceeded my expectations.

Tip and note:  Always wear nitrile type gloves whenever using any chemicals for detailing, repair, etc  A garage isn't complete without nitrile gloves and an air compressor..  Enough on that.

First off, they say you can use it on glass, and this would replace a lot of other cleaners and protectants, I'm not sure I would use anything to clean glass other than Invisible Glass.  I've tried them all, and to me, Invisible Glass is my go-to and ONLY glass cleaner.

Secondly, this DOES have a UV protectant in it, which of course, led me to purchase this.  I've said on here before that if you are going to take the time to detail, and make the effort, you should not waste your time with products (Especially interior products) that don't protect the interior from UV damage.. The sun is a killer on leather and plastic.. (And paint, over time).. So if you're going to use any products on your interior make sure they have UV protectants.

Thirdly, they say you can use this on Leather.  I for one, after working with it, probably wouldn't use it on my leather, I prefer some other products for that, and yes, don't bother using ANY leather treatment unless it has a UV protectant in it, or at least follow it up with something that DOES have a UV protectant.  I personally wouldn't use this on my leather.  I would use Chemical Guys' Sprayable Leather Cleaner and Conditioner (no UV protectant), and then follow it with Klasse Interior as the Klasse has a UV protectant.  The Klasse is also a water based formula (The original was oil based) and it also helps to tighten the leather a bit too.. Those two in combination make a nice look.

What's nice about this Total Interior Cleaner Protectant (TICP) is the way it goes on.  You want to use a fairly deep piled Microfiber cloth to apply it.  Pre wet the cloth with distilled water in a spray bottle.
Spray the TICP generously on the interior doors and plastics.  It works especially well cleaning off your armrests and control modules for windows, door locks.  I would generously spray it on the door panels and work it in, but I would not spray it directly on my speaker grills or into the control buttons, you want to work around that. For those areas, after you do the general door panels, or interior, and then come back and spray on your towel, and then hit the specific areas.

For the front dash, and the LCD screen, I sprayed onto my pre moistened towel, worked it in nicely, then I quickly grabbed another microfiber towel that didn't have a "pile" on it.  Almost like those microfiber dishtowels.  The reason why is when you go for that quick buff (And just a quick buff, that's all you need) you can and will create some static.. And when you create that static you'll break off peach fuzz off a piled microfiber cloth and it may stick due to the static.  So use a microfiber towel with no pile on it and quickly buff it, you don't need much, this product is "hot" and dries fairly quickly, a couple swipes, that's it.

I did get the baby oil scent, and it's reminiscent of that, but not too strong or overdone.  A nice fragrance.  It comes in a couple other scents.

The final look is very nice, it's not a shine or a heavy sheen, it's in between the OEM flat look (When you first purchase a new car) and a light satin.  Just enough sheen to spruce up the interior, but not like a basted turkey that looks greasy or oily.  Just right.

I have used this for over a year on the white Tesla interior and now I’m on my second bottle. I keep it in the trunk with a microfiber cloth. Smells amazing. Wipes away any grime from the white seats and helps protect it. I works great on the dash as well. Does not leave any sticky residue like other products. Leaves my center console with the nice matte black finish.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Awesome product. Don’t change price or quality!
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I’m a very loyal to great products. I used another brand for years, which had a nice scent and worked great. However, my last purchase the product had a fishy odor. So I had to try something new. This is awesome. Great price, nice scent, cleans well. Hopefully this product doesn’t change.
This cleaner works great on most car surfaces. Only downside if you spray and wait too long to wipe it can leave little stain marks. These can be removed but can be annoying if you miss a spot.

I've never purchased a Chemical Guys product that I didn't like. This one is no different. Works as expected. Used on both my 12.3in car touch screen and the 12.3in instrument cluster screen with 0 streaks (glass/touch screen was my biggest concern for an "all-in-one" cleaner). Worked like a charm. Great smell as always.

I'll be back.

I did some research on a good product to clean my cars interior. A lot of people said that they liked this item so I decided to give it a try. I have used it a few times on the interior so far and it works great. Easy to use and cleans well with absolutely no residue. It doesn't leave a ugly shiny finish either. It's a nice factory looking semi-gloss finish. I am very pleased with this product.
Great cleaning spray that leaves a new car smell. I'm going to purchase a second bottle

Received the Interior cleaner, and on the first use it leaked all over the place from the sprayer. I reached out to the company, and the hoops that they wanted you to jump through were ridiculous. My word was not enough, they wanted a video, batch number etc., etc. The product itself is fine, but should you need to reach out to customer service, be fair warned it is a lengthy  project to get a new sprayer sent out. Tough to recommend any product based on this experience.

I cleaned my whole car using this and we all can agree that there's nothing better than multifunctional use.
I'd say the only thing it's not fantastic for is the glass but no biggie
It does work you just need to make sure to spray it on the towel and not directly on the surface. Also, make sure to go in with fry towel right after.

category: Best Sellers in Tools & Home Improvement

items.title: All-new Ring Battery Doorbell, Head-to-Toe Video, Live View with Two-Way Talk, and Motion Detection & Alerts (2024 release), Venetian Bronze

amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I’ve had the Ring Doorbell for over a year now and I love how it gives me a peace of mind when leaving the house. I recently purchased this product as a Christmas gift for my parents because they saw how much I loved mine.

Installation:
The installation instructions were very clear and easy to use. I was able to set it up by myself within about 30 minutes. Once charged, the battery lasts a very long time when using the suggested default settings for motion detection and video. I haven’t had to recharge it since last May 2024. It is incredibly easy to remove the battery from the device to charge.

Motion detection, Video, and Audio:
The motion detection sensitivity can be adjusted based on how little or many alerts you receive. You also have the ability to use motion schedules to avoid getting alerts at certain times and days. The video quality is fantastic! I get alerts instantly when someone is approaching the front door. I love that I can login on the app and see who is approaching and speak to them, if needed.

Ring app:
The app is very user-friendly. I love that I can have more than 1 device connected to it. The app allows you to review videos, adjust motion settings and alerts, and provides posts from neighbors. The ring plan subscription is relatively cheap as well, at only 49.99 per year!

Get the peace of mind you deserve and purchase this product!

Super easy to install, the plans are very flexible (different tiers and pay by year or month), the video quality is great, and you can monitor everything from your PC if you want to. These cameras are leagues above the rest. The *only* complaint I have is that the newest generation of stick up cams do not have the ceiling mount and it needs to be purchased separately, but it's a minor grievance all things considered.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Great Video Quality and Battery Life
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
First 2 days review:
This product has great camera quality and because of the fish lens eliminates blind spots, even when placed at an angle.
The Battery life is great considering I have it set to highly motion sensitivity, and it only loses 1-2%, at most 3% of battery per day.
If you don’t buy the extra adhesive place holder for this product, which I didn’t, you need a drill capable of drilling 4 holes through the surface you’d like to place it on.
 I marked a sharpee line on the drill bit just how far the wall plug goes so I knew how deep to drill. There is a tutorial for this on the app as well.
Charging takes about an hour or 2 it seems so whenever I’m at home about once a month I can give it a charge, maybe less frequently than that considering its strong battery life.
The ring app works smoothly and the lag is only about one second. Video and Audio quality are definitely a plus.
A price of $50 and change per camera seems a fair deal in exchange for the additional layer of security. Especially with an upcoming holiday season.
I’ll update this review when I learn about the subscription services and what it entails.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Zero regrets on this spur of the moment purchase.
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I have been wanting a video doorbell for several years, but the options are so overwhelming, I kept putting it off.  When this Ring battery doorbell went on sale, I bought it, spur of the moment, and I have zero regrets .  When I'm on the back patio, or in a room farther from the front door, I couldn't hear knocking on the door. I live in an apartment complex, so there's a lot of activity, and I have had so many packages stolen.  No more.  I reviewed the video regularly in the beginning, and shortly after packages arrive, there were various strangers coming to my door.  As soon as they see the Ring Doorbell, they walk away.  Battery life is great, I have it set to the most battery usage on every option, and after 44 days, battery still at 23%.  The option for a 2 way conversation has been super useful, as well as the option for leaving messages.  The sound and picture is perfectly clear.  I signed up for the Ring annual plan, and in my opinion, it's a great value, love the option to share video, as well as many other features. When comparing different video doorbells in the past I kept leaning towards cameras that didn't require a monthly fee, etc, but in the end I'm happy to pay for the convenience and extra features that Ring offers (give me convenience, or give me death 😜.  The app is easy to use, set up simple and quick, and connecting to my Alexa speakers etc was seamless.  All around very satisfied with this doorbell.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Here is info hard to find
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
To start, buy the wired unit that comes with a rechargeable battery if you have an existing doorbell. Yes the 10 to 24 volt from your doorbell transformer will keep the battery charged. Yes the Ring doorbell will activate your existing doorbell chime so do not buy a separate chime. Don’t panic when you first wire it to existing doorbell wires. Part of the install process is for th Ring doorbell to look for an existing chime and initialize or whatever it does to know it is there. Putting this in my review as I had a hard time finding this info on the vendor sites or any reviews.
Setup is easy. The hardest part for my install was getting the mounting plate to be flat enough for the Ring doorbell to click into this mount. I have a stucco wall which creates flex in the mounting plate when attached. To get it to click I had to remove one of four screws and loosing others so that I could get my fingers on the back of the mounting plate to be able to get it flat to click to the doorbell. The mounting plate is plastic and easily flexes which will not allow the security snap to click into a locked position. Then to get the doorbell to not move, I added a shim behind.
Installed the doorbell is a bit clunky looking but video is good and works well taking video in the dark.
Hope this helps others.

Bought this and haven't put it outside yet, but we had it on the counter to test it out in the meantime. Charged it once and it's been over a month of constant use and it still hasn't died yet. It was super easy to create an account for myself and my roommate. It picked up on the cats walking across the room multiple times a day. I'd say it's the best sensitivity of any doorbell cameras I've had experience with. The video quality is good and the sound quality was way better than expected. I talked to the cats and they could tell it was me and where the sound was coming from. I talked to my roommate through it and we could understand each other easily.

The free trial ran out, but the plans aren't expensive. The most basic one still gives all the great functions and is only $5/mo. Once we get it mounted outside I'll likely subscribe.

amazon_reviews.review_title: DO NOT CONNECT A SOLAR CHARGER!!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The device itself worked great (5 stars) until it croaked after I connected a solar charger to it. It started charging perfectly (blue ring lighted and blinking).
The next day I realised that there weren't any notifications, and when I checked, it was "offline".
No response from the bell button.....it was dead.
I removed it and plugged in the regular charger........nothing.....(yes, the charger is good.......the same one that was used to full-charge it when I got it).
That's it for me and RING. I'm gone.
If you opt for a solar charger, use one from RING themselves. Connecting anything else is at your own risk (and probable expense).
Shalom.

Update (Edit).

So.......Ring reached out to me concerning my review. Phone calls, emails, ect.
I explained the situation described above, and they promised to send me a new door bell, which they did.
When I was about to set up the new one I noticed that the old (dead) one was showing full-charge on the app. I tried a reset (held both the orange And the bell buttons down simultaneously) and it came on. It came on and worked perfectly. I reinstalled it to its mount, and it's been going well ever since (approx a month).
The new (unopened) one? I promised the rep to ship it back to them. They "can't provide a shipping label" which they initially promised, and told me to keep the new one. I dont need nor want it. I tried to ship it back myself, but I'm not going to pay $140.00 to UPS it back to the States (I'm in the Caribbean).
So......5 stars 🌟 it is for ring. Great product and support (subscription, history playback, etc).
Battery is holding up well, and alerts are excellent (rarely misses).
Only connect chargers approved by them.
Shalom.

P.S.

Who need a  Ring doorbell for Christmas?

I love this product for a few reasons, I will start with my favorite one. There is a section on the app where people can post different things happening in the neighborhood, let me tell you if you ever need a laugh (especially in election season) watch this section it’s hilarious. It is also extremely useful everyone is engaged and posting when they see lost animals, if they get packages that aren’t there’s etc. I also love this doorbell because it was easy to set up and easy to connect to my phone. I love that no matter where I am I feel some security on what is happening in my home. Some alarm systems are way out of my budget for the time being so this has been a good alternative to that until I can put in a proper system. It doesn’t do everything but it does what you need it to.

I’ve had the Ring Battery Doorbell for a few months now, and it has completely transformed the way I secure and monitor my home. As someone who values both convenience and safety, this doorbell has been a game-changer in terms of functionality, ease of use, and peace of mind.

First, the installation was incredibly straightforward. I was able to set it up myself in about 20 minutes, thanks to the clear instructions and the fact that it's wire-free. The battery lasts surprisingly long too, even with regular motion detection and video use. I’ve only had to recharge it a couple of times, and the process is quick and easy.

The video quality is excellent—crystal clear even in low light, which is essential for those early morning or late-night deliveries. The wide-angle lens gives a clear view of who’s at the door, and the motion detection feature is spot-on. I get instant alerts on my phone whenever someone is approaching, and I love that I can see and speak to visitors directly through the app. Whether I’m at home or out running errands, I can easily communicate with delivery people or guests, which is great for convenience and security.

Another feature I love is the two-way audio. The sound quality is surprisingly clear on both ends, and I’ve been able to have full conversations with delivery drivers, neighbors, and even the occasional solicitor. The built-in siren also offers an added layer of security—if I ever feel unsafe, I can sound it directly from the app.

The Ring app itself is intuitive and user-friendly, with everything you need in one place. You can review video clips, adjust settings, and even link it with other smart devices for an integrated security system. It’s so easy to use, even for someone who isn’t particularly tech-savvy.

In summary, the Ring Battery Doorbell has exceeded my expectations. It’s reliable, easy to install, and provides real-time alerts that help keep my home secure. The video quality and two-way communication make it stand out among other doorbell cameras, and I feel much more confident knowing I can monitor my doorstep from anywhere. If you're looking for a high-quality, user-friendly doorbell camera that doesn’t require complicated wiring, this is definitely worth the investment!

So my car was broken into a few Sundays ago. My neighbor notified me because one of his cars were broken into on the same night by the same person. Unfortunately, his camera didn't catch everything that happened. I was so mad because this is the second time one of my vehicles have been vandalized. I got on Amazon and brought two Ring Flood Lights and this Ring doorbell - and haven't had a chance to even use it fully yet. Like my title says, you have to think installation before just buying security cameras and door bells. You will have to first, charge the ring doorbell battery and then drill holes to install the backing to whatever surface or object it will be mounted on. amazon_reviews.review_title: The Answer: How often to really change filter
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
First off, this filter is great.  It does exactly what it's supposed to and does it well for quite a while.  A couple of questions always come up around these things and I will try to answer them to the best of my knowledge as an engineer, and what I do for my family to keep them safe, but always do your own research because it's your water!

Pro-Tips Q&A:

Q. When my light turns on in the refrigerator that says "Change Filter", is the filter really worn out vs they just want me to buy a new one like a subscription service?

A. The answer to this is a frustrating "It depends".  Some refrigerators just turn on the light every X amount of hours of run time, usually around 4380 (six months).  Others measure how many gallons of water you have used and then turn on the light (usually around 200-250 gallons) but I have never seen one that measures ONLY gallons.  Some really new ones measure flow rate as a third indicator and when the flow changes by a certain percent it might trigger a filter change light because the computer assume that the filter is not doing its job any longer.

There may be a rating printed right on the filter to check how many gallons it's good for.  Most newish models fridges in the last 10-15 years watch both hours and gallons and turn on the light whatever is happens first, 6 months or 200 gallons.  The newest watch flow, gallons and time and will act accordingly.  I have one newer fridge that will turn on the light within a month if you use a cheap knock off.  I don't use this fridge for water or ice so it doesn't matter, but the flow of the knock-offs is effected such that the fridge believes that it isn't getting filtered properly and with these cheap knock-offs it's probably right so I went back to OEM even on that fridge and I just change it once per year and I'm done with it.  Safety first even if I don't plan to use it!

Q. So if I am not using 200 gallons, do I need to replace it every six months?

A. The answer is again, it depends.  Here is where it gets tricky.  How bad is the water coming in, and how much sediment and other things are you filtering out?  In other words, how hard are you working the filter?  The carbon in the filter only has so much capacity to absorb stuff.  At some point it becomes less effective and the water just passes through without being filtered because the carbon is saturated and can't handle any more.

The way I figured out what was right for me was I checked my water with those water check strips you can get here on Amazon, and I figured out exactly how bad the water was and what was in it.  Then I figured out how that compared to the average water across the U.S. domestic market (EPA numbers) and I figured out my water was somewhat cleaner than then average but also on the hard side.  This gives you your base to know around how much the filter will likely absorb.  If you figure the manufacturer assumes 200 gallons of average water, and you can adjust if yours is above or below average.  I figured in my case these OEM filters were in fact good for around 268 gallons without an issue, assuming they were in fact honest and 200 gallons was the right starting point (slight leap of faith there).  That was a 30%+ increase beyond the recommended number.  Using up my box of test strips basically proved it out although I figure around 250 gallons or so it would start to show less effective.

For the refrigerator that this particular filter is going into, it's not seeing 200+ gallons in a year.  Remember: Include ice creation in your water calculation.  Therefore for me, and this refrigerator (vs my others) I could get away with replacing the filter only once per year.

Q.  Why not go over a year and wait until 200+ gallons????

A.  Well that is because it is possible that bacteria can grow in the carbon and get transferred to the water.  This is unlikely, but possible and as the bacteria take up space itself (very little) you can make the filter less effective AND less safe, so I change it at LEAST once a year just to be safe.  The carbon in a solid state like in these filters does not break down when exposed to water so I don't have to calculator that.

Q.  Why not use a cheaper knock-off filter at half the price and replace it twice as often, or at a 1/4 the price and replace it twice as often saving lots of money?  Well, for me, I don't trust what these knock-off filters claim.  Some of the claims are so outrageous I am surprised they don't claim it cures cancer.  You find these on the Chinese knock-offs in particular.  Avoid these at all costs.  Some of the more reputable filter replacements are probably ok, but they might skimp on carbon, or have wider channels so there is less carbon, use a different density carbon etc. that may make them cheaper but less effective.  The only way to tell for sure is to take water measurements and then cut the filter open to see for yourself across samples taken over a 6 month period.  That is a heck of a lot of work when I know that I am replacing them at the right interval, plus I know for sure the OEM manufacturer doesn't want to get sued or take a reputational risk so their specs are likely correct.  I want to keep my family safe, so I just go with the OEM version and make my calculations.

Remember, you are DRINKING this.  Either in frozen Ice form or liquid form.  Your family, your children, your guests, friends, relatives drink this.  Spend a little extra money to get a filter you know works and will be safe for your family.

I hope you found this helpful.

I have this water filter in my subscribe & save. I have my order scheduled almost in sync with my “needs filter” display in my Whirlpool Refrigerator. The taste is fresh, nothing metallic. Simple push pull installation and removal. I like this for the ease of use and the water filtering tastes good. I save a little on price with subscription however these filters are a little pricey.
