amazon_reviews.review_title: Great illumination in areas never lighted before
amazon_reviews.review_comment: These lights are easy to install -- easy to charge -- and they are extremely convenient and productive.  We now have plenty of light under our kitchen cabinets and in a previously dark closet.  I order two sets of two and all four lights are working great.  They are illuminated through motion and they stay on for a short while afterwards.  This is perfect when we turn off overhead lights to leave the room -- giving us walking light that will turn off by itself.  These lights are a wonderful addition to our home.

Our old house had two LED strips that plugged into outlets so we would flip two switches to turn them on in the evening and shut them off at night. But the strip would not work in the new house because the cabinets are different heights and depths. I paid $12 for each rechargeable light so $24 per two pack. I bought just 2 lights to make sure we liked them then ordered 10 more. We have used them for a month and like them; brightness is good; very easy to install; some reviews complained about the mount falling off but not an issue (maybe they did not put them on correctly); i set one light to max brightness and it lasted 10 hours; yes it's a pain to turn on 12 switches every evening but that only takes 30 seconds; we end up charging 3-4 lights each day so I bought a "MaxLax USB Charger Station,10-Port 50W/10A" for $12 so there's enough ports to also charge two phones and other gadgets.

Install: Cabinets are wood but rather than use the screws to mount the plates I stuck the sticky side of the plates to the wood. After you remove the plastic from the two mounts, put the mounts on the back of the light (light is held to mounts by a magnet) with the sticky side up. Then get the light in place under the cabinet and push up on the whole thing- light with mounts attached, and the mounts will stick. Do not try to attach mounts without the light because it's impossible to line them up correctly. I wanted each light two inches from the front edge of the cabinet so every time I stuck my hand under there the switch would be in the same place. I taped a 2 inch scrap of wood under the cabinet and mounted the light right next to it- that also kept the lights straight. After the first light I did not even bother with the tape- I just held the block in place then smushed the mounts to the cabinet. After they are charged, I put them back under the cabinet with the switch always on the right side so i do not have to guess which end to look for the switch on.

Specs: Lights are 10 inches long and 8 inches of that is the LEDs. They have a low profile so you do not see them under the cabinet. When we found we had to charge the lights every few days (we were hoping for once a week) I looked into the 1800 mAh spec which is some measure of the battery, and I found similar lights with up to 5,000 mAh. But they had the exact same "lasts up to 8 hours on max brightness." I think because they had more LEDs or put out more light- the battery was better but it did not extend the max time before needing a charge. I finally found a light about the same size with a 4,200 mAh battery that lasts 20 hours but it's $20.

So the drawbacks are turning on and off so many switchs and having to charge them. But it only took a couple minutes to install one light- I installed all 12 in less than an hour. I guess I could have bought one 20 inch light for the bigger cabinets and had three less switches, but these were a good price. These would be perfect for use in a pantry, closet, over the utility sink in the laundry room- not really bright enough to put over a workbench, but if you set them to auto, every time you open the pantry door or use the sink in the laundry room you can see what you're doing. And with the light on auto it should only need to be charged once or twice a month.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Solved our under cabinet darkness problem.
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
We have always been disappointed with the dark areas underneath our kitchen cabinets. Getting an electrician to run wires for undercabinet lights would have cost a fortune.

We bought three boxes, six total light strips of the 14.7 inch models. Installing them was easy, as long as you are careful. Misreading the instructions can cause someone to have difficulty attaching them using  the sticky strip. Fortunately, they provide extra strips if an error is made.

Here's some installation tips if you are going to use the sticky strip.
1. Unpack the box making sure that all the components are present.
2. Get ready to fully charge each unit, being 'careful' to use the correct charger. Using one with too high a voltage and amperage may damage the strip. I used a USB Charger Block,5V 1A Wall Charger that puts out the correct power supply. Charge each unit until the green light comes on.
3. Determine where you wish to place them. If on the bottom of wooden kitchen cabinets, clean the wood to remove any grease buildup that may  have formed. Dove dishwashing soap in water works well. Dry each surface.
4. Remove the clear plastic film off the light (the side where the switch and charging light is).
5. Place the unit on a clean, smooth, firm surface light side down.
6. Notice that each end has 'U' shaped magnet symbols. The small rectangular magnetic strips must ultimately be place directly over each 'U' symbol.
7. Remove the 'BLUE' film of each strip 'first'.
8. Then place that side down onto the 'U' symbol making sure it fits down within the slightly depressed culvert-like placement guides.
9. After you align the magnetic strips in the correct position on top of the 'U' symbol. double check to make sure the white paper side of the magnetic strips are facing up towards you.
10 Carefully use a fingernail to gently remove the white paper covering, exposing the tacky surface. Try not to touch the tacky surface with your fingers. That tacky surface will hold the unit in place onto the underside of the cabinet.
11. Determine orientation where you want to have it 'exactly' adhere to the cabinet, because once you push the light strip firmly onto the wood surface, you will not be able to move it without damaging the magnetic/adhesion strips. If you do damage them, remember there are two spares included with each box.
12. Push each light unit onto the wood surface on the underside of each cabinet.
13. Use the switch to set the light to 'automatic', 'on', or 'off'.
14 Enjoy your lights.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Adjustable timer would make these great
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I purchased a set of these lights to use inside computer racks where lighting isn't always great, the magnets are strong enough to hold them in various places.

 The Battery life is great and I like the adjustable brightness, however, one thing that would make these just totally awesome would be to have some way to adjust the timer for the motion sensing mode.  perhaps a little pushbutton or something to change the timeout from 15 sec to 30,45,60 or maybe even up to a couple minutes.

  I have wired undercabinet lighting in my kitchen, but it's old and uses those florescent tubes.  I haven't used it in years because I hated the tubes always going bad or flickering.  After using these for other purposes I decided to use them for under cabinet lighting.  The 15 second motion timer is annoying so when I'm working in the kitchen I just turn on the ones in the area where I'm working to stay on.

  The 10 inch  model is 10 inches, however the 14 inch model is a little longer, not quite 15 inches, but more than 14.  The 14 inch models are brighter obviously.

 So far the metal plates that come with the unit have held to the cabinets just using the sticky adhesive, and I haven't had to use the little screws.  If the adhesive fails I'll just go get some command strips, not a fan of making holes in my cabinets even if they are tiny.

  I have found other used where these come in handy, stick them to any ferrous metals.  I've put them on my door that goes into the garage, I've also put them on the metal vertical braces on my garage door.  Great to have if the power ever goes out.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Go for the white frame Filtrete
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I purchased this white 6 pack and the brown 6 pack in hopes of understanding the 4 to 6 dollar difference between the white Filtrete MERV 5. While I believe the filter media are very similar, I was interested in increasing filtering quality while moving up from fiberglass style (MERV 3 ish). I could never find a fiberglass style in my price point with a more sturdy frame. The frame of the brown one is very similar to the fiberglass usually designed to be nested within one another and takes up less space for storage. The nested cardboard frame seams to lend its self to be less robust, more wiggle or floppy. My fear would be collapse into the air handler.

The fiberglass style would have to have years of blockage to even consider getting stucked in. The MERV 5 and up would be more sensitive to sooner blockage just because the filter media is of tighter construction hence  more particular capture. Regardless, I go no more than 2 months  per filter even fiberglass. The fiberglass will have the highest flow throughout the life because it's media is inherently less restrictive.

Now to the white Filtrete. This frame is much more robust and doesn't doesn't lend its self to nesting even though it has the exact same design. The cardboard is similar to soft drink 12, 24, and 36 pack can containers. This cardboard has a glossy finish probably on top of the brown cardboard, makeing it a more stiff and moisture resistant. I hope they don't change the paper formulation for the white frame.

The fit, installation and function of either the brown or white will be just as easy and filtering quality will be very similar.

Now for the price difference I returned the brown and request the white. To me the white is a better quality with the filtration qualities I need. The extra 4 to 6 dollars is well spent for peace of mind. Check out the pictures for more detail. I hope this helps you choice.

I can tell these aren't "top of the line" but that is why I bought them.  These are consumable, throw away after a certain amount of time.  I don't want higher priced ones, and don't want flimsy cheap junk.  These are a good value spot.  So far I'm pleased with them and happy with my purchace.

I love these, so real looking without the dangers. Had them for 2 months now and still going strong. Flame is bright and dances like a real flame. I will keep these little guys always on hand. Such a lovely warm glow.

Homemory's tea lights are the most illuminating fixtures compared to other coin-operated tealights that I've previously purchased. The realistic flickering lights give a glowing ambiance to any room or occasion. I love the small sizes, and they are safe for six-hour operation using their timers. I appreciate each contains a coin battery since each of these miniature candles costs up to and over five bucks each for a replacement. They're perfect for festive holidays and wedding celebrations, and because of their white hues, they stay wonderfully bright and last a long time. This tea light set is a delightful purchase at an affordable price. Highly recommend!!!!
I bought these to use with candle holder bowls with cutouts. The lights all work, and the glow/flicker is soothing. Very pretty and affordable!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Very easy to use lightweight flickering tea candle lights
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Not much to write, as they work, color temperature was accurate for description ordered. they don't put out much lumens, just enough for served purpose. Purchased to line stoop for Halloween. They don't provide much light, but flicker and look good. They easily fit in little glass tea candle holders. Easy to use on/off switch on bottom. I have not had to replace any batteries yet after about eight hours of full use.

I've only had three of them in use so far.  Batteries were pre-installed which was nice.  However, in my curiosity; just to see, I tried to open the battery door on one--using a large slot screwdriver--and the entire bottom of the candle started turning.  I'm sure it's not supposed to do that just to change the battery.  Otherwise, they are rather festive.  The ones I'm using are in frosted glass tea-lite holders so the whole thing changes color.  The original ad showed them being used in Jack-O-Lanterns, but I'm hoping to employ them through the Christmas season instead.  (And maybe to provide a little mood lighting around the hot tub on occasion.)

Saw these recommended by Wirecutter in the New York Times for lighting up a jack-o-lantern. Okay, I thought, there's a dozen of them, so I can put the pumpkin out with one of these each night for 12 nights, figuring that they'd last about 24 hours or less each. Wasn't going to run out in the middle of the night and turn it off, and would probably forget all about it by morning, so one each night for 12 nights.

Well . . .

Came the second night . . . and the first candle is still going. So I just leave it on that night.

And the next . . .

And the next . . .

And . . .

The darn thing was still going strong by the 12th night!!!!

I make that out to be about 250+ hours for one candle. Amazing. Nuclear powered or something?

Ordering more to scatter all over the house for the holidays. Oh, I know - not as attractive as real candles, but have you checked the price of votives lately?

items.title: GE XWFE Refrigerator Water Filter, Genuine Replacement Filter, Certified to Reduce Lead, Sulfur, and 50+ Other Impurities, Replace Every 6 Months for Best Results, Pack of 1

amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The GE XWFE Refrigerator Water Filter is an excellent replacement option for those seeking clean, great-tasting water in their homes. As a genuine GE product, it fits perfectly into compatible GE refrigerators, ensuring a hassle-free installation and optimal filtration performance.

Key Highlights:
Certified to Reduce Lead: One of the standout features of this filter is its ability to significantly reduce harmful contaminants like lead. Given how dangerous lead exposure can be, it's reassuring to have a filter certified to handle this. After replacing my old filter with the XWFE, I noticed an immediate improvement in water clarity and taste, offering peace of mind that my family is consuming safer water.

Effective Sulfur Reduction: Sulfur can give water an unpleasant taste and smell, and this filter does a great job of reducing these issues. The water tastes fresh and odor-free, which enhances the overall drinking experience.

Easy Installation: Installing the GE XWFE filter is straightforward and doesn’t require any tools. Simply remove the old filter, align the new one, and click it into place. The water flow was restored quickly without any delays, making it a convenient replacement process.

Long-Lasting Performance: The filter lasts for approximately six months, depending on usage, which is fairly standard for most refrigerator filters. This longevity makes it cost-effective, especially when considering the high-quality filtration it provides.

Certified by Leading Standards: This filter is NSF/ANSI certified, meaning it meets stringent requirements for reducing contaminants in drinking water. GE’s commitment to quality and safety is evident through these certifications, and it adds to the reliability of the product.

Considerations:
Price: The GE XWFE filter is priced higher than some third-party alternatives, but the quality, certification, and genuine compatibility with GE refrigerators justify the premium cost.

Availability: Depending on where you shop, it may not always be in stock, but ordering online through trusted retailers often ensures quick delivery.
The GE XWFE Refrigerator Water Filter, Genuine Replacement Filter is the exact fit for our refrigerator. It installs quickly and works great. Great price.

I recently purchased the GE Fridge Water Filter for my refrigerator and I am extremely satisfied with its performance. This filter has made a noticeable difference in the taste and quality of the water and ice coming from my fridge.

Installation was quick and easy, and the filter fit perfectly in my GE refrigerator. I noticed a significant improvement in the clarity and taste of the water almost immediately after replacing the old filter with this new one.

I appreciate that this filter is certified to remove various contaminants and impurities, providing me with clean and safe drinking water. Additionally, the filter has a long lifespan, so I don't have to worry about frequent replacements.

Overall, I highly recommend the GE Fridge Water Filter to anyone looking to improve the quality of their water and ice from their refrigerator. It is a reliable and effective product that has exceeded my expectations.
It filters our water just like it’s supposed to. Good price compared to hardware stores, easy to install, quick filter flush, then crystal clear H2O. Bobby Boucher would approve ✅
Installed and Works  without an issue.  It has been at least 2 months and it is still functioning.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Expensive but worth the price. Solved our issue.
amazon_reviews.review_comment: We initially had a GE filter when we first got the fridge.  I switched to two other brands because the price was way cheaper for 3 of them vs the 1 GE filter……A few years later we noticed silver flakes in the water. I decided to flush the line but it would always return. We stopped using the fridge water for 6 months thinking it was the fridge.  I read a review of the other filters and someone mentioned the same issue.  I went back to the GE water filter and no more flakes and now the water is crystal clear.

The GE XWFE Water Filter is a reliable replacement filter certified to reduce over 50 impurities, including lead and sulfur, ensuring clean, great-tasting water. It’s easy to install and lasts up to 6 months. While it’s pricier than generic alternatives, its compatibility with GE refrigerators and proven performance make it a solid choice for health-conscious users.
Keep your family safe by replacing your filter when needed. Long lasting, works with our refrigerator, steady flow, no complaints.

The GE instruction sheet was incorrect, there's no adapter on top of the MSWF filter which needs removing. Just peel off the tin foil cover on the top of the filter, fill the new filter to the top with tap water and screw it in the holder in the refrig. Drew off two large glasses of water and by then the "sputtering" had stopped and I was back in operation. Last thing to do was resetting the red "replace filter" LED warning light.

Literally took 30 seconds and didn't spill a single drop of water although I had put a dishcloth under the old filter before I removed it based on some other folks claiming they got water all over the inside of their refrig. Obviously user error. When the old filter is unscrewed, a check valve shuts off the water supply to the filter. I think the folks with problems pushed up on the new filter when trying to screw it in; thus, unseating the check valve and spraying water inside their refrig. Don't do that...just let the threads on the filter do the work as you screw it in the mount.

Amazon's price was competitive with other discounters, shipping was free and I received the filter in five days.

What's not to like about the Amazon ordering process? Absolutely nothing!

The old filter lasted 10 months (family of three) and I just put an alert in my computer to order a new filter in nine months so I'll have one on hand the next time.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Ordered this genuine GE filter, but it shut down the ice and water system after installing it.
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
Then several days later, I put the old same exact looking filter in, presto everything worked as it had been.  When pressing the water or filter reset button, it would show "leak" on the display, but there was no water leaks anywhere.
We use a lot of ice and not having it caused me to try to figure out what was wrong after several days.  Some reviews (elsewhere) and user comments said that not replacing the filter causes the system to shut down via an RFID chip in the filter. Indeed there is a warning label behind the filter regarding RFID.  Since we have a hole house pre-filter, we don't feel the need to replace our filter more often than every 1-2 years. I've asked for a replacement filter to be resent and I'm sending the new one that doesn't work back (high-5 amazon!).  These filters are wayyyyy to pricey to be jacking us around like this, if not replacing does indeed shut down our water and ice dispensing GE execs should be fined and jailed.

items.title: FogWorx Extreme High Density Fog Juice - Quart – 32 Fluid Ounces of Long Lasting, High Output, Odorless Water Based Machine Fluid for 400 to 1500 Watt Machines

amazon_reviews.review_comment:

Easy to Use and Effective

Impressive Fog Quality

The quality of the fog produced was truly impressive. It had a beautiful, dense consistency that lingered in the air just long enough to create an enchanting atmosphere without overwhelming the space. The fog added depth to the lighting effects I had set up, making colored lights appear more vibrant and dynamic. It was perfect for creating a dramatic effect during a dance party and even added a touch of mystery during a themed dinner.

Safe and Non-Toxic

As someone who is always concerned about safety, I was relieved to find that this fog machine liquid is non-toxic and safe for use indoors. It didn’t have any unpleasant odors or harmful chemicals, which is a huge plus when you have guests around. Knowing that my family and friends were safe while enjoying the fog made the experience that much more enjoyable.

Versatile for Various Occasions

Whether you’re planning a Halloween bash, a wedding reception, or a school play, this fog machine liquid is incredibly versatile. I can already envision using it for future events, like a spooky haunted house or a romantic evening under the stars. The possibilities are endless!

Final Thoughts

Overall, I highly recommend fog machine liquid for anyone looking to add a touch of magic to their events. It’s easy to use, produces high-quality fog, and is safe for all to enjoy. Don’t underestimate the impact that fog can have on your atmosphere—it truly transforms any space into something extraordinary. Get ready to impress your guests and create unforgettable memories with this fantastic product!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Elevate Your Event with FogWorx Extreme Fog Juice
amazon_reviews.review_comment: The FogWorx Extreme High Density Fog Juice is fantastic for creating a spooky atmosphere! This gallon of fog juice is long-lasting and has a high output, making it perfect for parties, Halloween events, or theatrical productions. It's odorless and water-based, so it doesn't leave any lingering smells. Easy to use with any standard fog machine, it really takes the ambiance to the next level.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Excellent fog fluid for very dense fog
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Tried FogWorx High Density Fog Juice for the outdoor Halloween display and had excellent results.  It is extremely dense and settles really well in place when wind is light.  It is so dense that it can really limit visibility when it builds up in areas.  It is completely odorless and very clean, but does leave some residue after several hours of use in fog output hoses.  It is very clean cycling through 1000 watt fog machines and had no issues with them the entire time using this fluid.
Works good

amazon_reviews.review_title: Great Fog Liquid – Perfect for Testing My New Machine!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I purchased the quart size of this fog liquid to test out my new JDR Mini 500w Fog Machine, and I’m impressed so far! I chose the smaller quart size to start, but I love that I can scale up for larger events. The liquid isn’t thick and messy at all. It pours out quick like water.

The bottle came securely sealed, which is always a plus, and there’s absolutely no smell to the liquid—something I really appreciate since it will be used at my roller rink. I can’t wait to try it out and see how the fog performs with this product.

So far, it seems like a great purchase at a fantastic price! Highly recommend grabbing some while it’s on sale!

It produced very thick fog.  It did it's job.

This is the only fog juice to use.  Creates very thick smoke.  We use a 1500 fogger for high volume output.  Don't shop for cheap smoke.  It will ruin your fog machine.  Count on products that make sense.

items.title: Ernie Ball Regular Slinky Nickel Wound Electric Guitar Strings 3 Pack - 10-46 Gauge

amazon_reviews.review_comment: Ernie Ball Regular Slinky strings are my go-to for electric guitar. The 10-46 gauge offers a perfect balance of flexibility and durability, with a bright, consistent tone. The 3-pack is a great value, ensuring I always have a fresh set on hand. Definitely the best strings for your money feels great and is as durable as you would expect from 10s

They offer a great balance of brightness, warmth, and clarity, making them perfect for all playing styles. The nickel-plated steel feels smooth, is durable, and keeps its tone for a long time. They’re responsive, stay in tune well, and provide reliable performance every time. Simple, proven, and consistently great—these strings are a must-have for any guitarist.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Great Tone and Durability for Rock and Beyond!
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I’ve been using Ernie Ball Power Slinky Nickel Wound Electric Guitar Strings (11-48 Gauge) for a while now, and I couldn’t be happier with them. These strings are perfect for my playing style, especially if you're into rock, blues, or any genre that needs a bit of extra punch. The 11-48 gauge strikes a nice balance between thickness and playability, giving me just the right amount of tension for both rhythm and lead playing.

The tone is fantastic—bright, clear, and full-bodied, without being too harsh. They really bring out the best in my guitar, and I love how consistent the sound stays over time. I’ve had these strings on for a few weeks now, and they haven’t lost their brightness or gotten overly dull like some other brands I’ve tried. Plus, the nickel-wound construction gives them a smooth feel, and they stay in tune well, even with heavy strumming or bending.

I also appreciate the durability of these strings. I tend to play a lot, and these Power Slinkys hold up surprisingly well. They’re definitely more resilient than some of the other strings I’ve used in the past. Overall, I highly recommend these strings for any guitarist looking for great tone and long-lasting performance without breaking the bank. They’ve definitely become my go-to!

Very easy to tune. It's the right size for guitar strings where I want to play a myriad of genre. Very slinky and blendable so it's easy to install. It looks very high quality and the sound is chef's kiss. It has bright treble and mids as well as thumping bass. It's functionality to bend and play so many genres ranks it as the best guitar strings I've bought.
Been using them for years. Same strings and great quality, best all around string… dependable, the secret to never breaking a string on stage, ready for this? Change them often! Just saying!

Absolutely love the Ernie Ball Power Slinky Nickel Wound Electric Guitar Strings! The 11-48 gauge offers the perfect balance between playability and tone. I’ve noticed a significant improvement in both sustain and clarity since switching to these strings. They feel smooth under my fingers and are great for everything from heavy strumming to intricate fingerpicking.

The nickel winding delivers a warm, rich tone that really brings my guitar to life, whether I’m playing clean or distorted. Plus, they hold their tuning remarkably well, even after extended playing sessions. I appreciate the consistent quality and reliability that Ernie Ball strings are known for.

Overall, these strings are a fantastic choice for any guitarist looking to enhance their sound and performance. Highly recommended!

amazon_reviews.review_title: The industry standard old reliable strings.
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Even on a brand new (though cheap) Strat clone, these strings made a noticeable improvement in sound and sustain. They are great for everyday use or performing. Only when you go to the studio or play for your best girl, would you want anything fancier.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Not my usual gauge, but growing on me
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
The ridiculously cheap $6.99 for a 3pack is why I purchased the max of 4 sets. I have been playing GHSboomers Custom Lights (9-46) and EB Hybrid Slinky’s (9-46) since 1985…
Most of my guitars are tuned to dropC# on 6string and Drop AD on 7tring.
The main difference between the boomers and slinky’s is Round Core vs Hex Core. I prefer the RoundCore boomers for dropC# or even DropC as the output of each string actually generates more power and slightly less noise whereas the slinky’s ARE yep, more slinky (ever so slightly more flexible at the same tuning which is really only noticeable on the wound strings)…
My son sent me the link because it is/was a fantastic price… 3pack for the price of 1pack, and even though I would NOT switch to Primo Slinky 9.5-44, they are perfect for my dozens of guitars I don’t play that need new strings occasionally.

What do they feel like?They feel like Daddario 9’s.
It feels like the hex cores of these Primo Slinky’s 24/34/44 wound strings are the exact cores of the Super Slinky 24/32/42…

So, IF you currently play either 9’s or 10’s, and the price is still $6.99 for a 3pack, you won’t regret buying them for a second!!

Heard that Paul Gilbert uses 8.5-40's, he's one of my favorites so I had to try these. They sound good, and dont feel really as light as i thought. Which is good. They are at that perfect place between. I usually use a 9-42, and likely wont go back to those now. So I stocked up on these in the event they become hard to find. Only 2 companies make these, Ernie Ball and GHS.

items.title: AGPTEK Smoke Machine, Fog Machine with 13 Colorful LED Lights Effect, 500W and 2000CFM Fog with 1 Wired Receiver and 2 Wireless Remote Controls, Perfect for Wedding, Halloween, Party and Stage Effect

amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I was going to install a laser in my theater room so I bought the fog machine to enhance the laser effects.
So first time I tries it out was inside the house and had the machine set on AUTO. On auto it will emit fog for like 30 seconds, as Im watching my whole house fill up with fog im wondering if its ever going to shut off that was a really long 30 seconds and every smoke detector (like 8 of them) all went off, if you have smoke detectors don't use it inside it took 30 minutes to clear the fog out of the house and the whole time the smoke detectors were going off not fun. The directions are a bit vague and the black box with the red button that plugs into the machine they wrongly call a remote control and it's confusing because there is a wireless remote that comes with it too. All the led lights work but it was daylight in the house when I tested it and I never planned on using the Leds as I was going to use it with a laser. It seems like it will go through fluid faster then you think so make sure you buy a couple bottles of juice or a gallon of it. I returned the laser because the patterns it made were lame and I wasn't going to be able to use the fog machine inside the house with the smoke detectors. I will try and update the review after Halloween since I think it will work well for that.

amazon_reviews.review_title: works fine. ready for Halloween next
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I tried this a few times to make sure it worked fine as I plan to use it for Halloween in the prop which I will be setting up in the next two weeks or so.
The light is only useful if you're pointing the light towards the fog and will be viewing it standing at the same place as where the light is coming from but in my case I plan to point it towards the street so the fog will be back like lit and it will not show up therefore the light part is not something I am going to be using

I am Satisfied with this Machine. It was definitely worth every dime. It came fast.
I ordered it 1 day before I needed it & it arrived early the day I needed it a Saturday.
I purchased for my Daughters 16th birthday party & it worked Wonders. It Puts out Alot Of Fog.
Not too much but just Right. I ran the Machine on & off for about 4-5 hours. The Remote is perfect. It’s small and has a clip chain attached to it. My daughter clipped it on her jean loop and was able to hit the button with ease and without being noticed. When the remote button is tapped the Machine across the room automatically puts of a continuous burst of fog. The fog does stop after a few minutes. However i read that it’s a way to make run continuously. I didn’t get that far. I didn’t have time. Overall i Love it and I don’t have any Complaints at all. amazon_reviews.review_title: Elevate Your Party Game with This Top-Quality Fog Machine
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I recently purchased a fog machine from Amazon for a party I was hosting and I was thoroughly impressed with its performance. The fog machine is high-quality and worked flawlessly throughout the entire event. The added disco light was a great touch and added to the overall atmosphere of the party.

The remote control that came with the machine was also a convenient feature that made it easy to turn on and off throughout the night. Additionally, the machine was relatively easy to set up and use, even for someone who has never used a fog machine before.

One important thing to note is that the fog liquid is not included with the machine and must be purchased separately. This was a bit of an inconvenience, as I had to make an extra trip to the store to purchase the liquid, but it was well worth it in the end.

Overall, I would highly recommend this fog machine to anyone looking to add some excitement to their parties or events. The high-quality performance, added disco light, and convenient remote control make it a must-have for any party host. Just be sure to purchase the fog liquid separately!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Designed to break: 2 out of 3 broke on first day of use
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I really want to love this product because it has everything I was looking for:
+ produce powerful and dense fog if high density liquid is used
+ IR remote (be careful if using multiple, they are all on the same "channel"
+ controllable strong LEDs
+ auto-mode

However, the auto-mode works in a way where it constantly outputs fog so you:
(1) Run out of fog liquid within 10-15 minutes
(2) The unit likely overheats
(3) There is NO AUTO-OFF when the fog liquid is gone so you will hear the pump complain before the units inevitably fails. The manual even calls out not to operate the unit without fog liquid inside but that's pretty much impossible unless you stand next to it and wait until you hear the pump running dry. This could have been easily avoided by adding one more really that checks for fog liquid level but they cheaper out on it. I will be returning all of these.

Paired with Ghost Fog Machine Fluid
This worked great!
The auto function is kind of the opposite of what it says, instead of like 25seconds on 2 mins off, it's like 1 minute on and 10 seconds off. But the remote worked through the door! (Button needs to be plugged in for remote to work) So for the beginning of Halloween i used the remote, then for the last hour or so i put it on auto when i realized i didn't want to keep a half used bottle of fog around for a year 😂

The lights were bright, the fog was good, didn't scare kids too much as they walked by and wasn't too loud. Definitely went through liquid faster when on auto, but that makes sense. Smell was mild.

It was small enough i could hide it behind a rock! I also liked this one because the handle could prop it up so it angled upward for the light.

Easy to use!

We'll see how it holds up over time.
Perfect i absolute love it works well all tho it hard to turn the smoke off even the remote controller don’t work on it but it ok i can easily turn it off from the back switch

This was a fantastic purchase for my production of "I Hate Hamlet".  It filled our stage with fog with ease and the ability to use the remotes to change the color and discontinue the spray was a big bonus (we had it tucked away in a part of the stage that didn't have access for someone to go turn it off after the scene had started).  It is a really excellent product at a cheap price - I may have to pick up a couple more for future productions.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Worked well, will definitely trigger smoke alarms
amazon_reviews.review_comment: It's very important to get a chiller with this smoke machine. If you don't the smoke will engulf the entire room and, for me at least, it triggered the smoke alarm after about five minutes. The lights on it were quite nice, and the unit is quite compact, which I liked. Amazing for the price as well!

amazon_reviews.review_title: Good little fogger but low fluid capacity
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Got the fogger started and it heated up quickly. Set it on continuous mode and fog came out non stop. However shortly after the fluid ran out and i heard the pump start to whine. The next day I took it apart and found the tank capacity to be very small.  Found a tank from an old fog machine and connected it. Poured the fog juice from the original container to the spare one. The fluid level only went to the level my finger was at in the picture. If you are going to sell a fog machine with a continuous mode, you should have more fluid capacity built in.

My mom and I were dancing in the kitchen to a Anthony Hamilton song ("The Best of Me") that it played through Spotify. It works with my music app Star Maker amazingly, YouTube and more. Again do not expect a "star quality" concert microphone. This is great tool to have fun singing or listening to music by yourself or with friends. So if you are on the fence do not hesitate.

Get yours today! Oh did I mention that I love it😁!!!
FYI: the green is my favorite. It's a beautiful cool green tone. Soo relaxing to look at... And the blue clearly looks nothing like their ad. It's more of a sky blue. Ooh I can't wait till karaoke night👏🏾👏🏾!!

Greatest of glory be ware! We tone deaf heroes are on the march with this magnificent musical toy. I bought this for my wife for Christmas and to my surprise her cloddish brother snatched it from her hands inviting all kinds of sibling rivalry resentments to the center of our jovial celebrations. He instinctively began divulging the most basic of thoughts as he encountered them like some torturous streaming of consciousness. Soon after the toy disappeared for many weeks… until it was new year’s, my wife had been drinking since noon, and her inner diva demanded dominion. She and one of her best friends sprung out before all our guests and began screeching and wailing some butchered versions of a fleetwood mac song. The grip of trauma raced around the room like an evil spirit trying to possess us, evident by the wave of soured faces. Our guests demanded they stop the torment or they’d leave. I was elated when my wife through all manner of infantile protestations relented and released us from our pain. Until ten minutes later when she and her friend bust out again like the opening act for hell. And so our guests stormed off writhing in agony. However after they had finished a tenth song of utter musical calamity they invited other weary family to join in the mayhem. The device itself does not produce a full musical sound. It is flat and sounds a bit like music is being played in a different room. However it does make clear the song and does deliver clearly the voice being sung. We haven’t used any of the effects yet. It paired easily with different phones and we were able to find ample songs with lyrics on Apple Music and YouTube. Once those two banshees had finished that is when the joy begun. Suddenly we were all romantically falling into the abyss of our dreams as celebrated singers. We hit the high notes, dazzled on the runs and belted with great passion the essence of truth of the songs we sung. Suddenly our captors had become our creators and we could rejoice with them in their songs too. It was a strange pivot to experience. We sang gleefully into the new year with abandon and love for the songs we cherished. My recommendation is to get one, sing to your heart’s content and let the scoffers be damned.

We purchased this for our fun Friday night karaoke sessions on YouTube. They are very easy to use and have excellent battery life. I also love the complimentary case. They don't get very loud, so they're perfect for some at-home fun, but not suitable for events or places where you need to amplify your voice for more than 10 people.

This is the second karaoke mic I am buying because the first one was awful. This one is great, the speaker quality is awesome, I sometimes just use it as a speaker to play music for my kids and like how you can adjust the volume on both the mic and the speaker separately. My kids love playing with this so glad that it's sturdy and you can take it apart to clean the top.

I have been playing with this karaoke microphone last 3 hours, it is so fun. I feel like a real singer. It connects to your phone and you choose any song from you tube that has karaoke style and you can sing and read the lyrics also on the phone, I did not know the microphone was a karaoke device I was surprised, with this price it’s quality is top. I recommend this item 100%.

I like the way the microphone handles in your hand.My issue is that the volume on the microphone is so low even on highest setting and you can barely hear anything back. I want a microphone that allows me to also connect to my speakers and not just the sounds from microphone. Buyer be where.

amazon_reviews.review_title: The Ulimate Mic For A Girls Trip
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
Our recent girls' trip became an unforgettable adventure, and one of the reasons behind the unforgettable memories was this fantastic microphone. It's the kind of accessory you didn't know you needed until you had it, and it added so much fun to our trip. Each lady purchased a different color. First off, the portability of this microphone is a major win. It's compact, lightweight, and fits easily into a small bag, making it the ideal travel companion. We carried it around effortlessly, whether we were exploring the city, lounging on the beach, or having late-night karaoke sessions in our cozy Airbnb. The sound quality was surprisingly impressive for a device of this size. It delivered crystal-clear sound, which was perfect for impromptu sing-alongs and capturing the laughter and chatter of our group. Plus, it's compatible with smartphones, so we were able to record our adventures and preserve our favorite moments with ease. The wireless connectivity was a game-changer. It meant no fumbling with cords or being tethered to a speaker. We could pass the mic around or dance around it, adding a whole new dimension to our party nights and outdoor escapades.
The battery life exceeded our expectations. It lasted all day and then some, so we never had to worry about it running out of juice in the middle of the fun. Charging was quick, which was a lifesaver. But what truly set this microphone apart was the versatility. It had built-in effects, like reverb and echo, which allowed us to channel our inner pop stars and create entertaining vocal performances. It even doubled as a Bluetooth speaker for our playlists. In summary, this microphone was an unexpected highlight of our girls' trip. It added a layer of fun, entertainment, and memories that we'll cherish forever. If you're planning a getaway with friends and want to take your adventures to the next level, this microphone is a must-have. It's versatile, portable, and endlessly entertaining. Our trip wouldn't have been the same without it, and I can't recommend it enough for anyone seeking to amplify their travel experiences.
My daughter loved this for her taylor swift costume! Works great and durable!

I bought this for an event where I was unsure if they provided a microphone into their sound system. for the price, it was a no brainer to get this as a backup. I wish the volume was able to go a little bit louder but it's pretty good. I like that it can recharge. I just wish that it didn't make a chiming noise when it turns on and off.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Doesn’t automatically come with a carrying case
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
While the microphone itself is okay, mine did not come with any protective carrying case or wind screens which seems like a rip off considering all the other reviews come with them
Update to say: in the package was a customer service slip that says “if you require a portable case, don’t hesitate to reach out”

items.title: D'Addario Guitar Strings - Acoustic Guitar Strings - 80/20 Bronze - For 6 String Guitar - Deep, Bright, Projecting Tone - EJ11-3D - Light, 12-53 - 3-Pack.

amazon_reviews.review_comment: I own over 10 guitars and have played for over 20 years so it is safe to say I have tried alot of different  strings. I bought these for a guitar I was donating so I went with these because they were cheap. I love that they are color coded for which string they are. That makes them easy to use and they sound great. Nice bright sound a little more string screech than my go to brand ernie ball earthwoods and they seem to go out of tune a little quicker for the first few days. They still sound bright and have good warmth  after 2 weeks and they hold a tune just fine, so Id say they have proven durability. Great value for the money. I have seen no rust on them and they play smooth.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Initial impression: Terrible. Verdict after 2 months of playing them: really good.
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
That might sound too drastic, but...
I was replacing a set of Elixirs out of which I got 2,5 months of daily playing.  I put on strings from low E to high E, getting each string in tune before I put on the next one.  As I was tuning the G string, D string which I tuned right before it suddenly snapped. What the hack? I've been playing this particular guitar since 2012, but I decided to examine the G tuner hole to see if there was something wrong with its edge, but it was fine. So there goes another string from a different pack.
Now on to the way they sounds on my jumbo Alvares. The sound is unbalanced, over bright, lacks in bass and is forced.
But the true problem with these strings that they can only be played with a pick. I spend more time playing fingerstyle and these strings are like a perfect chainsaw for fingernails. Would I ever buy these string again? No. Would I put them on my guitar if somebody gave them to me as a gift? No. Would I give them to somebody as a gift? Well if I wouldn't like the person that they were going to strangulate with these strings - I would!
2 stars

Amendment 1
After several weeks of playing I actually like the played-in sound.
Upgrading my vote to 3 stars.

Amendment 2
These strings still ruin my nails like no other strings ever have, when I strum strum them without a pick. But that aside, after two months of playing them daily with sweaty fingers, they still sound neither dull or nor muffled, but rather surprisingly pleasant and balanced.  My favorite Elixir Polyweb would have lost their original sound by now and their famed coating would have pealed  and be hanging off the strings. But these strings just keep going.
Upgrading my vote to 4 stars.

Amendment 3
Feb 1 2023
All right - it has been three months of playing these strings, at least an hour every day. And - despite them even sometimes being exposed to my cheddary fingers (wine + cheese + guitar), they still sound GOOD.
This is truly remarkable. Yes, Polyweb keeps the bright side of played-in sound longer, but no strings have ever kept it up to such abuse without sounding like a dying cat. (I love cats.)
D'Addario strings is one of 3 brands I use . I find them all to be similar in tone and touch . The price of the 3 pack of D'Addario strings is very good . I am always pleased with their performance .

amazon_reviews.review_title: One of the three packages had two 12g strings instead of a 16g and a 12g.
amazon_reviews.review_comment: Great set of guitar strings.  I have been buying old wrecked guitars and repairing them.  These are perfect for acoustics.  One of the packages had two "High-E" strings --12g-- instead of both 16g-"B" and 12g-"High-E".  HHMmm.  I went to the local guitar shop for a spare 16g --cheap.

amazon_reviews.review_title: Great Strings at a Great Price
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I use a lot of strings, and this is a great deal on these 80/20 bronze strings. They're bright and lively without being harsh sounding. They don't last as long as phosphor bronze ones in my opinion, but I change strings before every show or recording session, so they always get changed before they start to lose their life anyway.

amazon_reviews.review_title: My only go-to strings now for my acoustic
amazon_reviews.review_comment:
I've been a 10g player since I was 16.
I also used to buy only DRs. Until I only had a couple dollars left and needed a cheaper pack of strings. Found these, and they brighten up my guitar and have a way better life span, and sound way fuller than above mentioned other brand.

My guitar (by choice) is the Joymusic $40 acoustic. I love cheaper sounding guitars and these actually make that thing sound amazing. They also did well when I had my full sized Jasmine. But.. I love my little guitars that give a more amateur, campfire player sound..

amazon_reviews.review_title: D'Addario Guitar Strings - Acoustic Guitar Strings
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I am restoring a number of vintage guitars and needed new strings. I have been playing guitars for about 50 years now and D'Addario strings have been my favourites for most of that time. They are always good quality and they sound wonderful. Best of all is that they are budget friendly.
They make some of the best strings for the best price

amazon_reviews.review_title: I use D'Addario strings on almost all of my guitars
amazon_reviews.review_comment: I currently have 9 guitars and 11 basses, and I have used D'Addario strings on my guitars since the early 1970's.  They work well, they stay in tune, sound great and are easy on the fingers.  I've tried most of the guitar strings on the market, and while most of them are quite good, I still find myself going back to D'Addario strings.
Very nice strings.
